clauses.text:

"EULA" shall mean the End User License Agreement issued by the respective OEM, governing the use of their proprietary software.

clauses.title: Payment Terms
clauses.text:
All invoices shall be payable within thirty (30) days from the date of receipt. Disputes must be raised within seven (7) days of receipt.
Late payments attract a penalty of 2% per month.
In case of conflict, invoice terms shall prevail.

clauses.text:
IP rights remain with OEMs or licensors.
Softcell does not claim ownership over third-party IPs.

clauses.title: Indemnity
clauses.text:
Softcell does not provide indemnities for IPR of resold products.
Indemnities, if applicable, are provided by the respective OEMs.

The Service Provider acknowledge and agree that the ownership of Intellectual Property of the Bank shall always remain with the Bank. 
Nothing contained in this Agreement constitutes a license, limited or otherwise, in favour of the Service Provider and/or to Representatives to use Intellectual Property of the Bank. The Service Provider shall use Intellectual Property of the Bank only after prior written consent of the Bank on such additional terms and conditions as prescribed by the Bank.
The Service provided by the Service Provider shall at all times, be deemed be to work for hire and the Bank shall at all stages of completion to deem to be the owner of such work/ service being provided by the Service Provider. All copyrights and intellectual property rights, if any, in and to the Service provided/ to be provided/ mobile app/software and/or any other assets including information developed by the Service Provider shall rest with the Bank at all stages and all times. If applicable, the Service Provider waives its right under Section 19 (4) and Section 19A of the Copyrights Act, 1957 and all other laws, acts, regulation which restricts the Bank’s right to use the Services without any restriction.

and collectively as the "Parties". WHEREAS:

the Company has been utilizing the services of the Service Provider and now desires to formalize the arrangement through a comprehensive Agreement; the Service Provider agrees to continue providing services to the Client, subject to the terms and conditions set forth herein.
NOW, THEREFORE, THIS AGREEMENT WITNESSETH and it is hereby agreed by and between the Parties here to as follows:

[●], a company incorporated and registered under the Companies Act, [1956/2013] having its registered office at [●] (hereinafter referred to as the “Service Provider”, which expression shall unless repugnant to the context and meaning thereof deem to mean and include its successors and permitted assigns).
AND
ICICI BANK LIMITED, a company incorporated under the Indian Companies Act, 1956 (and a company within the meaning of the Companies Act, 2013) and and a banking company within the meaning of the Banking Regulation Act, 1949, having its registered office at ICICI Bank Tower, Near Chakli Circle, Old Padra Road, Vadodara, Gujarat - 390 007 and its corporate office at ICICI Bank Towers, Bandra Kurla Complex, Mumbai, Maharashtra - 400 051 (hereinafter referred to as "ICICI Bank", which expression shall, unless it be repugnant to the subject or context, include its successors and assigns). 
The Service Provider and ICICI Bank are individually referred to as a “Party” and collectively as “Parties”.

Sarvatra is a leading end-to-end solution provider for the rural banking sector and designs software products that address all major technological and operational concerns of this sector. Sarvatra Anywhere Money Platform enables the rural branches of banks to offer modern services, like Any Branch Banking, ATM/Debit Cards, RTGS/NEFT processing at branch-level, SMS Alerts, Statement by Email and Phone Banking to rural customers in a cost effective manner. Sarvatra's offerings allow banks to participate in a larger financial ecosystem by providing them access to the national ATM/POS network through connectivity with NFS.
Softcell is a leading Systems Integration services company in India and specialises in sales of IT software, hardware, solutions and consulting services to corporate customers in India. Softcell specialises in providing end-to-end IT solutions to corporate customers and its portfolio of solutions (“Services”) include: Software reselling, Hardware and Networking services, IT Security services, Engineering (MCAD/PLM) Services, Testing Services and Internet Hosting services.

The Merchant expressly and unequivocally agrees to and hereby does indemnify, save, defend and hold harmless the Bank and its officers, directors, employees, shareholders, agents, consultants and other representatives, successors and assigns of, from and against all, direct and indirect, claims, damages, fines, penalties, losses, costs and expenses, including attorneys’ fees from time to time, incurred by the Bank in respect of or in the course of performing its obligations under this Agreement or otherwise incurred as a result of : :
Merchant’s breach of any representation, warranty or covenant made/ undertaken by it under this Agreement;
Merchant’s breach of Applicable Law;
Any claim made or proceeding commenced by any Customer or any third party against the Bank, in relation to or in connection with the Services; or
Merchant’s wilful misconduct or gross negligence in connection with the Agreement.
As a result of faulty, inaccurate or unauthorised information having been provided to the Bank by the Customers and/or the Merchant respectively.
Notwithstanding anything contained in this Agreement and any other document, this Clause shall survive the term of this Agreement.

INTRODUCTION
This Service Level Agreement is entered into is made and entered into on __ day of ____ 2024 (“Effective Date”) by and between:
Softcell Technologies Global Private Limited, a company incorporated under the provisions of the Companies Act, 2013, having its registered office at 303 B-Wing, Commercial-1 Kohinoor City, Kirol Road, Kurla (W) Mumbai – 400070 Maharashtra, India (hereinafter “Softcell”) and (hereinafter “Aster”) to govern the provision of support services for ManageEngine applications (hereinafter “Services”).

SUPPORT METHODOLOGY
Single Point of Contact (SPoC): Aster shall appoint a SPoC responsible for coordinating support requests.
Escalation: Escalations can be initiated by sending a ticket to support@softcell.com, with copies to designated contacts. Softcell will respond according to the defined severity levels.
OEM Escalations: If Softcell cannot resolve an issue, it may escalate to OEM support, provided active support contracts are maintained by Aster.
Operating Hours: Support will be available from 9 AM – 8 PM IST on weekdays, with potential extensions for critical issues based on assessment.

LIMITATION OF LIABILITY
Softcell’s maximum liability under this SLA is limited to 5% of the total fees received from Aster in the three (3) months preceding a claim, excluding any indirect, consequential, or incidental damages, regardless of the cause of action.

clauses.title: Data Protection & Privacy
clauses.text:
Softcell complies with applicable data protection laws, including the DPDPA once enforced.
Softcell does not store or process personal data in its ordinary business.
Once effective, If data is processed, relevant legal provisions shall apply.
variants:
The Service Provider shall ensure that in order to account for Virus based contingencies, it shall maintain a back-up of the Confidential Information.
The Service Provider will ensure that the Services are provided in strict compliance with the internal cyber and security policies of ICICI Bank as communicated to the Service Provider in writing from time to time and that no forms of Viruses or Vulnerabilities are introduced into ICICI Bank’s network and information systems via the Services or Software or any computer system, database, software, equipment, web site, or processes used to provide the Services.
If a Virus or Vulnerability is found to have been introduced into any environment/system as described above, the Service Provider shall within [●] business days notify ICICI Bank in writing of the introduction and at no additional charge to ICICI Bank, assist ICICI Bank in reducing the effects of the Virus or Vulnerability and if the Virus or Vulnerability causes an interruption of the Services, a loss of operational efficiency or loss of data, assist ICICI Bank to the same extent to mitigate and restore such losses.

Both the Parties hereby acknowledge that it shall derive benefits in terms of its business growth and strengthening of customer base as a result of entering into this Agreement, which by itself is sufficient and complete consideration for themselves to enter into this Agreement. Neither Party shall be obligated to pay any other consideration in a monetary form or otherwise to the other.  
GOVERNING LAW, JURISDICTION AND ARBITRATION
This Agreement shall be governed by, and construed in accordance with, the laws of India. The Parties agree that if the process of the courts is required to be invoked for enforcement of Clause 13.2 below, including for seeking of any interim relief prior, during or after invocation of Clause 13.2 below, the competent courts and tribunals at Mumbai shall have exclusive jurisdiction and both the Parties hereto submit to the same.
All disputes, differences and/or claims arising out of these presents or as to the construction, meaning or effect hereof or as to the rights and liabilities of the Parties shall be settled by arbitration to be held in Mumbai in accordance with the provisions of the Arbitration and Conciliation Act, 1996 and shall be referred to the sole arbitration of a person to be nominated mutually by both the Parties. The award including interim award/s of the arbitrator shall be final and binding on all Parties concerned. The arbitrator may lay down from time to time the procedure to be followed by him in conducting arbitration proceedings and shall conduct arbitration proceedings in such manner as he considers appropriate.

All notices, approvals, instructions, demand and other communication given or made under this Agreement shall be in writing and may, subject to Clause 1.2 (Notices) hereof, be given by facsimile, electronic mail, personal delivery or by sending the same by pre-paid registered mail addressed to the relevant Party at its address, facsimile number or email set out in Schedule 1 hereto (or such other address, facsimile number or email as the addressee has by 5 (Five) days’ prior written notice specified to the other Party).
Any notice, approval, instruction, demand or other communication so addressed to the relevant Party shall be deemed to have been delivered (i) if given or made by registered mail, 5 (Five) days after posting; (ii) if given by personal delivery at the time of delivery; (iii) if given or made by facsimile, upon receipt of a transmission report confirming dispatch; and (iv) if given or made by email, upon receipt of a mail delivery report confirming receipt by the other Party.

SCHEDULE 5

Delivery. Upon receipt of payment, we will deliver any applicable license keys, access credentials and other information necessary for end users to download and use, or otherwise access and use, the Products and Services subscribed to in the Order, directly to the delivery contact specified in the Order in accordance with our standard delivery procedures. If we deliver the license keys or access credentials to you, you agree that you will, in turn, deliver them directly to the end user specified in the Order, and not to use or access the Products or Services in any way. You must either delete all license keys and/or access credentials promptly thereafter or maintain them in confidence. You agree not to (and will not allow any third party to) take any steps to interfere with or defeat any license keys or access credentials.

Dispute Resolution; Arbitration. In the event of any controversy or claim arising out of or relating to this Reseller Agreement, the parties hereto shall consult and negotiate with each other and, recognizing their mutual interests, attempt to reach a solution satisfactory to both parties. If the parties do not reach a settlement within a period of 60 days, any unresolved controversy or claim arising out of or relating to this Reseller Agreement shall proceed to binding arbitration under the American Arbitration Association (AAA) Rules. The parties shall seek to mutually appoint an arbitrator. If the parties cannot agree on a single arbitrator, then there shall be three (3) arbitrators: one selected by each party, and a third selected by the first two. Arbitration will take place in Boston, Massachusetts. All negotiations and arbitration proceedings pursuant to this Section 14.1 will be confidential and treated as compromise and settlement negotiations for purposes of all similar rules and codes of evidence of applicable legislation and jurisdictions. The language of the arbitration shall be English.

The Service Provider shall ensure that in order to account for Virus based contingencies, it shall maintain a back-up of the Confidential Information.
The Service Provider will ensure that the Services are provided in strict compliance with the internal cyber and security policies of ICICI Bank as communicated to the Service Provider in writing from time to time and that no forms of Viruses or Vulnerabilities are introduced into ICICI Bank’s network and information systems via the Services or Software or any computer system, database, software, equipment, web site, or processes used to provide the Services.
If a Virus or Vulnerability is found to have been introduced into any environment/system as described above, the Service Provider shall within [●] business days notify ICICI Bank in writing of the introduction and at no additional charge to ICICI Bank, assist ICICI Bank in reducing the effects of the Virus or Vulnerability and if the Virus or Vulnerability causes an interruption of the Services, a loss of operational efficiency or loss of data, assist ICICI Bank to the same extent to mitigate and restore such losses.

Both the Parties hereby acknowledge that it shall derive benefits in terms of its business growth and strengthening of customer base as a result of entering into this Agreement, which by itself is sufficient and complete consideration for themselves to enter into this Agreement. Neither Party shall be obligated to pay any other consideration in a monetary form or otherwise to the other.

clauses.title: Confidentiality
clauses.text:
Parties must maintain confidentiality of shared information.
Confidentiality obligations survives for 3 years post termination.
variants:
The Service Provider shall preserve the Confidential Information in accordance with the legal/regulatory obligations of the Bank subject to confidentiality obligations under this Agreement. Upon reasonable advance written notice, Service Provider shall provide copies of all the Confidential Information including data captured, processed and stored in relation to this Agreement to the Bank and its auditors, attorneys, and representatives and the Bank, its auditors, attorneys, and representatives, shall have the right to inspect/audit all such Confidential Information at the Service Provider’s registered office and/or any other premises. The Service Provider shall ensure the preservation, protection, security and confidentiality of the Confidential Information in its custody. The Service Provider shall return all Confidential Information as and when demanded by the Bank on or termination of this Agreement whichever is earlier. The Service Provider shall be bound by the confidentiality obligations under this Agreement during the Term and after termination of this Agreement.
A copy of the Service Provider’s policies, procedures and control measures should be provided to the Bank. The Service Provider obtain the Bank’s consent (such consent should not be unreasonably withheld) before amending such policies, procedures and control measures.

This Collaboration Agreement is made and entered into at Mumbai and on this ________ day of __________, 2020 (“Effective Date”) hereto amongst:
HDFC BANK LIMITED, a company incorporated under the Companies Act, 1956 and licensed as a bank under the Banking Regulation Act, 1949, having its registered office at Bank House, Senapati Bapat Marg, Lower Parel, Mumbai 400 013, acting through its branch at the location mentioned in Schedule 1 hereto (hereinafter referred to as the “Bank”, which expression shall, unless it be repugnant to the context or meaning, be deemed to include its successors and assigns) of the ONE PART;
AND
SOFTCELL TECHNOLOGIES GLOBAL PRIVATE LIMITED, a Company incorporated  under the Companies Act, 2013 and having its registered office at 303 B-Wing, Commercial-1, Kirol Road, Kohinoor City Phase 1 Rd, Kurla, Mumbai 400070 ( hereinafter referred to as the “Merchant”, which expression shall, unless it be repugnant to the context or meaning, be deemed to include its successors and permitted assigns) of the OTHER PART; 
The Bank and the Merchant shall be individually referred to as a “Party” and collectively as the “Parties”.
WHEREAS:
The Merchant is engaged  in the business of reselling various products and has, inter alia, developed   the Merchant Platform (as defined hereinbelow) for facilitating sale and resale of various products. 
That the Bank has a financial product, through which the Bank extends credit facility on variety of consumer items to the employees of its corporate customers (the “Bank’s Offerings”). 
The Merchant is desirous of expanding its business and with the aforesaid intent approached the Bank for collaboration in regard to the Merchant Platform with the Bank’s Offerings.
After due negotiations, the Parties have agreed to collaborate on a non-exclusive basis to make available for the Target Customers (as defined hereinbelow), who meet the Bank’s credit and other internal parameters and who the Bank determines (in its sole discretion) are eligible for loans, a hassle free way to avail Debit Card EMI and/or pre-approved loan facility solely for the purpose of making whole or part-payment of the Product(s) Price (as hereinafter defined) (as may be applicable) (“Loan(s)”) for  the purchase of the Products from the Merchant Platform, subject to certain terms and conditions;
In this regard, the Merchant wishes to undertake various obligations to the Bank, to enable the Bank to consider giving of and/or grant the Loans to the Target Customers Accordingly, the Parties have agreed to enter into this Agreement.
IT IS NOW AGREED BY AND BETWEEN THE PARTIES HERETO AS UNDER:
RESPONSE TIME AND SEVERITY LEVELS
Payment and Delivery.
Reseller Obligations and Liability.

This Non-Disclosure Agreement (“Agreement”) is entered into as of _______ (“Effective Date”) by and between Trans American Information Systems Private Limited (a Mastek Limited company) a company incorporated under the provisions of Companies Act, 1956 having its registered office at 103, Iris Tech Park, Sector 48, Sohna Road, Gurgaon 120018 (hereinafter referred to as “TAISTech”); and Softcell Technologies Global Private Limited, a company incorporated under the laws of India with Registration No. U74999MH2018PTC313645 having its registered office at 303 B-Wing, Commercial-1 Kohinoor City, Kirol Road, Kurla (W) Mumbai – 400070. (“Vendor”).
WHEREAS hereinafter, TAISTech and Vendor are referred to individually as a “Party” and collectively as the “Parties”.
AND WHEREAS TAISTech may engage Vendor to carry out ________________ (“Purpose”). To accomplish the Purpose of this Agreement and to enable Vendor to carry out the obligations agreed between Vendor and TAISTech, and/or for entering into discussions pertaining to the Purpose, TAISTech may require to share Confidential Information of TAISTech or its affiliates. Parties propose that such disclosure should be subject to the following terms and conditions:
For the purposes of this Agreement, the words “Confidential Information” shall mean all and any information, in any form which is not in the public domain concerning the business and/or finances of TAISTech, its affiliates including without prejudice to the generality of the foregoing, reports, interpretations, forecasts, records, corporate business plans, financial projections, financial details and accounts, products, services, planned products, planned services, marketing and advertising plans, marketing and advertising requirements, budgets, fee levels, customer/client lists, commissions, commission charges, pricing policies, operational data processing capabilities, software, hardware and related specifications, all information about research and development, terms and conditions of the consultancy agreement to be signed between Vendor and TAISTech and terms of this Agreement.  
All such Confidential Information relating to the Purpose furnished by or on behalf of TAISTech (the “Disclosing Party”) to Vendor (the “Receiving Party”) is included as Confidential Information whether furnished before or after the date of this Agreement, and regardless of the manner in which it is furnished. Subject to Receiving Party is able to prove, Information which is not defined as Confidential Information includes information such as:
was already legally in the possession of the Receiving Party prior to the disclosure thereof by the Disclosing Party and is not subject to any obligation of confidentiality; 
at the time of its disclosure to the Receiving Party is public knowledge or subsequently becomes public knowledge other than as a result of some act or omission on the part of the Receiving Party in breach of the terms of this Agreement;
at any time after the date of this Agreement is disclosed to the Receiving Party by a third party who is not under any duty of confidentiality or secrecy to the Disclosing Party in relation thereto; 
is disclosed to the Receiving Party on a non-confidential basis;
is independently developed by employees of the Receiving Party to whom no disclosure of the Confidential Information has been made.
Subject to the provisions at clauses 5, 6 and 8 below, the Receiving Party shall not, without the prior written consent of an authorized representative of the Disclosing Party, communicate or divulge to any third party whomsoever, or make any use of any Confidential Information of the Disclosing Party or any of its clients or customers.  Notwithstanding anything contrary contained herein, Receiving Party hereby unconditionally agree that, Disclosing Party shall be entitled to use Receiving Party’s personal data, Confidential Information (if any) that may be provided to Disclosing Party. Disclosing Party shall be entitled to share such personal data with prospective clients in India and abroad from time to time basis for business purpose.
The Receiving Party agrees that it will keep such Confidential Information in trust and strict confidence for the sole benefit of the Disclosing Party and will take all reasonable measures to protect the Confidential Information and avoid the unauthorised use, disclosure, publication or dissemination of the Disclosing Party’s Confidential Information (such measure in any event to be no less than the degree of care that it uses to protect its own confidential and proprietary information of a similar nature and importance). 
The Receiving Party may disclose the Confidential Information, or any portion thereof, to the Receiving Party’s directors, officers, employees only on a strictly need to know basis, if such disclosure is required for the purpose of evaluating the Purpose, and provided that they agree to treat the Confidential Information in accordance with the terms of this Agreement. Prior to disclosing the Confidential Information, the Receiving Party shall require such personal who needs to know the Confidential Information, to sign definitive non-disclosure agreement with similar or more stringent terms and conditions. Disclosing Party shall have the right to monitor on a continuous basis the use of its Confidential Information by the Receiving Party and its employees/consultants/agents, as the case may be. By giving twenty (24) hour’s notice, the Disclosing Party shall be eligible to enter upon the Receiving Party’s premises and conduct the necessary security audit to satisfy itself the protection of its Confidential Information on the hands of the Receiving Party.
The Receiving Party agrees that it will not use any Confidential Information furnished to it by the Disclosing Party for any other purpose other than to evaluate and/or facilitate the Purpose. Receiving Party confirms that Receiving Party and its employees/consultants are aware of the information security policy and procedures of Disclosing Party and any changes made from time to time and undertakes to keep itself aware of the requirements of such policy and procedures and shall comply with the same.
Receiving Party is fully aware regarding Disclosing Party’s conformity with the law, on the privacy subject. Receiving Party shall always abide by all the requirements and provisions of The Information Technology Act, 2000 as amended and updated till date, with the related rules and regulations. In case of any non-compliance, Receiving Party shall be liable for civil or criminal consequences thereof. Receiving Party shall also abide by all the instructions issued by Disclosing Party from time to time, and in case any violation Receiving Party shall promptly communicate in writing, through the proper channel, to Disclosing Party. 
All Confidential Information furnished to the Receiving Party shall remain the property of the Disclosing Party and nothing contained herein shall be construed as granting the Receiving Party any rights with respect to the Confidential Information disclosed, other than as outlined in this Agreement.
Notwithstanding the provisions of clause 3, the Receiving Party may make disclosure of the Disclosing Party’s Confidential Information as is required by law, by the order of a court, or by any governmental or other regulatory authority, but then only to the extent so required, and provided that:
The Receiving Party will promptly notify the Disclosing Party of the existence, terms and circumstances surrounding the request (unless in doing so the Receiving Party would breach the terms of the subpoena, court order, or a statutory or regulatory obligation upon the Receiving Party); and 
The Receiving Party exercises reasonable efforts to obtain assurance that confidential treatment will be accorded to that portion of the Confidential Information that is being disclosed.
Receiving Party will immediately notify to the Disclosing Party upon discovery of any loss or unauthorised disclosure of the Confidential Information of the Disclosing Party and shall immediately take adequate measure to protect such disclosure.
Immediately upon the written request of the Disclosing Party and in a form acceptable to Disclosing Party, the Receiving Party will return all materials, documents and papers containing Confidential Information supplied to it by the Disclosing Party, together with any copies made of such materials, documents or papers and any other documents which are based upon, contain or otherwise reflect the Confidential Information, or confirm that such Confidential Information has been destroyed.
This Agreement is intended only to facilitate the exchange of Confidential Information and is not intended to be, and shall not be construed to create a teaming agreement, joint venture, association, partnership or other business organisation or agency arrangement and Vendor shall not assign its interest under this Agreement without the prior written consent of TAISTech.
This Agreement embodies the entire agreement and understanding of the parties hereto and supersedes any and all prior agreements, arrangements and understandings, whether oral or written, relating to the matters provided for herein. No alteration, waiver, amendment, change or supplement hereto shall be binding or effective unless the same is set forth in writing signed by authorised person of each Party.
If the Vendor at any point in time become the subject of a merger or any other form of reorganisation or internal reconstruction it is agreed that the successor in law to Vendor shall also be bound by the terms of this Agreement as if such party were an original party hereto.  
No exercise or failure to exercise, or delay in exercising any right, power or remedy vested in TAISTech under or pursuant hereto shall constitute a waiver by TAISTech of that or any other right, power or remedy. 
If it is found in a court of competent jurisdiction that any term or provision hereof is invalid or unenforceable, the Parties agree that the remaining terms and provisions hereof shall be unimpaired and shall remain in full force and effect.
Vendor shall not publicise the fact of this Agreement or the subject matter thereof without the prior written consent of TAISTech.
The term of this Agreement will be of ____ year from the Effective Date. All the provisions of this Agreement shall survive termination or expiry of this Agreement. 
Vendor agrees that, Disclosing Party doesn’t make any representation or warranty, express or implied with respect to the accuracy or completeness of any Confidential Information provided herein under. Disclosing Party shall not be liable and responsible for any direct or indirect damages arising out of Disclosing Party’s breach of any terms and conditions hereof. 
In case of any unauthorized disclosure or breach of the Confidential Information or any of the clauses of this Agreement by the Receiving Party or its employees/consultants, the same shall be notified immediately but not later than 2 working days from the happening of the event by the Receiving Party to the Disclosing Party. In case Disclosing Party becomes aware of any unauthorized disclosure or breach of the Confidential Information or any of the clauses of this Agreement by the Receiving Party or its employees/consultants, the Disclosing Party shall intimate the same to the Receiving Party immediately and demand an explanation from the Receiving Party for the same and shall be entitled to recover any damages and to take any legal action as mentioned herein. Vendor agrees that if any term in this Confidentiality Agreement is breached, or threatened to be breached, a remedy at law may be inadequate and, therefore, without limiting any other remedy available at law or in equity, an injunction, specific performance or other forms of equitable relief or monetary damages or any combination thereof shall be available to TAISTech.  
Vendor agrees and undertake that with effective from Effective Date, they will not solicit directly or indirectly any business or offer any product, services or take up any assignment with TAISTech’s clients or affiliates. Vendor shall further agree and undertake not to solicit or hire any employee of TAISTech for a period of Twenty Four (24) months from the date of termination or expiry of services agreement or this Agreement (whichever is later).  
This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of India, and both Parties hereby irrevocably submit to the exclusive jurisdiction of the courts of Mumbai.
This Agreement may be executed in any number of counterparts, each of such executed copy shall constitute to be an original. 
The Parties acknowledge and agree to be bound by the contents of this Agreement, by executing this Confidentiality Agreement under the hands of their duly authorised officers.
IN WITNESS this Agreement has been executed and delivered by the parties in accordance with the laws of the territory in which it is incorporated on the date first above written.

This Master Service Agreement is made and entered into on __ day of ____ 2023 (“Effective Date”) by and between:
Softcell Technologies Global Private Limited, is a Service Provider incorporated under the Companies Act 2013 and having its registered office at 303, B-wing, Commercial-1 Kohinoor City, Kirol Road, Kurla(W) Mumbai – 400070 (hereinafter referred to as the “Service Provider”, which expression shall, unless repugnant to the context or meaning thereof, be deemed to mean and include its successors and permitted assigns) of the One Part; 
and
Sirion Labs Private Limited, is a company incorporated under the Companies Act 1956/2013 and having its registered office at 10-B, Sagar Apartments, 6 Tilak Marg, New Delhi - 110001 (hereinafter referred to as the “Customer”, which expression shall, unless repugnant to the context or meaning thereof, be deemed to mean and include its successors and permitted assigns) of the Other Part. 
The Service Provider and the Customer are hereinafter, wherever the context requires, individually referred to as a “Party” and collectively as the “Parties”. 
WHEREAS,
The Service Provider is a leading provider of business-to-business IT infrastructure solutions and is an authorized reseller of the subscription to the OEM Software (as defined below).
Based on the expertise and representation of the Service Provider, the Customer has decided to procure certain licenses for Crowdstrike license (“OEM Software”) from the OEM (as defined below) and is now seeking Services from the Service Provider subject to the terms and conditions pursuant to this Agreement.
NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual promises and covenants set forth herein, and for other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which are hereby acknowledged, the Parties agree as follows.
DEFINITIONS:
Capitalized terms used in this Agreement, will have the definitions assigned below, or as indicated in context. Except as otherwise provided in this Agreement, technical terms commonly used in the industry will be so construed. 
“Agreement” shall mean this Master Service Agreement, including its annexures, amendments, modifications and supplements thereto.
“Confidential information” shall mean all non-public information in oral, written, electronic, optical or other form including any information / data / materials, whether specifically designated as “confidential” or not, which (a) relates to past, present and future research, Intellectual Property Rights, development, business activities, chat history and details, products (prototype or otherwise), software, hardware, trade secrets, services, courses and its materials, discoveries, concepts ,techniques, models, data, documentation, processes, procedures, know-how, marketing techniques and materials, contents, marketing and development plans, business models, customer names, financial information, technical information and information related to customers, vendors, employees, price lists, pricing policies, financial information, trade secrets and  personal data, and technical knowledge, written or verbal or any other electronic form or contained in any media or machine-readable form, and (b) has been identified as confidential or would be understood to be confidential by a reasonable person under the circumstances in which it is disclosed. Confidential Information does not include information that (i) was in the public domain at the time it was disclosed or becomes part of the public domain after disclosure, without breach of this Agreement ; (ii) was known to the  receiving Party  prior to disclosure or becomes known to it from a third party which is legally entitled to disclose it; or (iii) is required to be disclosed under applicable laws and regulations or by competent governmental order or legal process; (iv) was independently developed by the receiving Party without use of the disclosing Party’s Confidential Information. In case the Confidential Information disclosed orally, the Parties shall ensure to reduce the same in writing within 10 days from the date of disclosure.
“Fees” shall mean the fees payable by the Customer to the Service Provider for (i) the purchase of subscription(s) to the Software as per applicable Order and (ii) Implementation Services as per the applicable SOW.
“Implementation Services” shall mean the services rendered for implementation of the OEM Software including any consulting, training services as detailed in the SOW or any other services mutually agreed to be provided by the Service Provider and the OEM to the Customer. 
“Intellectual Property Rights” includes, but all patents, trademarks, ideas, concepts, creations, discoveries, inventions, know-how, permits, service marks, brands, trade names, trade secrets, techniques, methods, processes, proprietary information and knowledge, technology, computer programs, databases, copyrights, licenses, franchises, formulae, designs, data, documents, instruction manuals, records, memoranda, notes, whether or not copyrightable or patentable, or any written or verbal instructions or comments and other Confidential Information.
“IPRs” or “Intellectual Property Rights” shall mean all rights, benefits, title or interest in or to any Intellectual Property, anywhere in the world (whether registered or not and including all applications for the same). 
“Master Service Agreement/MSA” shall mean the this Agreement entered into between the Service Provider and the Customer for  Services of the OEM Software and other documentation entered into between the Service Provider and the Customer excluding any end-user license agreement, which may be entered into by the end user of the Customer with the OEM. 
“OEM” shall Original Equipment Manufacturer and/or any of its affiliates. 
“Order(s)” shall mean a written order, that the Parties may enter into from time to time under this Agreement for the sale and purchase of the subscription(s) to the Software , setting forth the details as to the subscription,  Fees for the subscription(s) to the Software and other terms mutually agreed between the Parties. 
“Reseller Agreement” shall mean the agreement entered into between the OEM and the Service Provider by virtue of which the Service Provider is appointed as a reseller of the OEM, including any schedules, annexures, modifications and supplements thereto. 
“Software” shall mean software, provided on subscription basis by the OEM through the Service Provider as reseller to the Customer, subject to terms and Conditions of this Agreement. 
“Services” shall mean Software and Implementation Services, as enumerated in Annexure A.
“Statement of Work” or “SOW” shall mean the individual document containing the scope of Implementation Services, milestones, deliverables and other details, which has been executed between the Parties pursuant to this Agreement and the format of which is annexed herewith as Annexure B.
“Term” shall have the meaning as ascribed to it clause 13.
SCOPE OF THIS AGREEMENT:
Scope:
Subject to the terms of the Reseller Agreement and subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, the Service Provider hereby agrees to provide Software along with Implementation Services of OEM Software to the Customer.
The Service Provider shall provide the Services and Implementation in accordance with the mutually agreed-upon SOW. The Service Provider shall not commence any Services or Implementation until the applicable Fee has been paid in full.
The Customer acknowledges that:
the access to avail the Services shall be directly available to the Customer as per the MSA as well as the End User License Agreement (“EULA”) signed between OEM and Customer; and the Service Provider is not privy to the terms of the EULA.
The Service Provider acknowledges that:
the regularity and quality of the Services performed shall be the essence of this Agreement.
SERVICES:
For obtaining the Services, the Customer shall sign an SOW with the Service Provider via e-mail to the Service Provider’s designated sales representative. Any SOW shall not be binding on the Service Provider, unless the same is accepted by the Service Provider in writing. 
The Customer shall provide all of the requested information including, without limitation, the identity of Customer, the Customer’s business, and email addresses. All such information must be accurate and complete. 
The Implementation Services shall be provided electronically to the Customer or as per the agreed terms of the SOW, and the same shall be subject to the terms of the MSA.
During the course of the MSA, the Customer may rely or act on business processes, instructions & applications, systems related to the OEM Software and Implementation Services that are owned, designed, licensed, and managed by the Service Provider. The Customer in any case shall not incur any liability for relying and or acting on such business process, instructions, application, systems related to the OEM Software and Implementation Services on account of any defects or inadequacy within the Service Provider’s Implementation Services.
APPROVAL PROCESS FOR IMPLEMENTATION SERVICES:
Approval Process: 
The Service Provider shall ensure to provide the Implementation Services to the satisfaction of the Customer. In the event, Customer delivers objections with respect to the Implementation Services/Deliverables that the Services doesn’t materially conform to the specifications agreed under applicable SOW then the Service Provide shall immediately resolve the reported objections but no later than (five) days from the date of reporting. With respect to the Implementation Services provided to the Customer by the Service Provider, except as otherwise agreed in the applicable SOW, the Customer shall be deemed to have accepted such Implementation Services and deliverables unless, the Customer delivers a written objection specifying how the Implementation Services/deliverables do not materially conform to the specifications agreed under any applicable SOW to the Service Provider within five (5) business days following the date on which the Service Provider notifies the Customer that the Service Provider has completed the Implementation Services/submitted the deliverables outlined in the SOW (“Acceptance Period”). In the event the Customer reports any such objection(s) within the Acceptance Period, the Service Provider shall resolve reported objection(s) in the Services within a mutually agreed time frame, which shall be the sole and exclusive remedy for the Customer. Upon receipt of the corrected Implementation Services/deliverables by the Customer, the timelines as stated under this clause for acceptance shall apply to the delivered Services/deliverables. Following any such Customer acceptance, the Customer will be deemed to have waived any claim against the Company with respect to such Implementation Services/deliverables. Consequently, the Customer agrees that any additional issues and/or requirements identified after such the Customer acceptance will need to be addressed as new requirements and billed to the Customer accordingly.

DATA SECURITY AND PROTECTION:
Service Provider will comply in all respects with the Data Protection Laws and Regulations and will provide such help and cooperation as is reasonably necessary or requested to the other to comply with the same. The Service Provider does not collect the Customer’s personal data. The Service Provider does not assume any responsibility for determining the purposes for which and the manner in which the Customer’s personal data is processed. 
Service Provider will not disclose or share personally identifiable information provided to it by Customer with any third party without Customer’ prior written consent (except as required by law pursuant to a valid governmental request). Service Provider agrees that it will not host, transfer, or access any Customer-provided personally identifiable information outside of the United States.
Billing:

Third-Party Beneficiaries:
This SLA is not intended to confer any rights or remedies upon any person other than the parties hereto.

The Service Provider shall preserve the Confidential Information in accordance with the legal/regulatory obligations of the Bank subject to confidentiality obligations under this Agreement. Upon reasonable advance written notice, Service Provider shall provide copies of all the Confidential Information including data captured, processed and stored in relation to this Agreement to the Bank and its auditors, attorneys, and representatives and the Bank, its auditors, attorneys, and representatives, shall have the right to inspect/audit all such Confidential Information at the Service Provider’s registered office and/or any other premises. The Service Provider shall ensure the preservation, protection, security and confidentiality of the Confidential Information in its custody. The Service Provider shall return all Confidential Information as and when demanded by the Bank on or termination of this Agreement whichever is earlier. The Service Provider shall be bound by the confidentiality obligations under this Agreement during the Term and after termination of this Agreement.
A copy of the Service Provider’s policies, procedures and control measures should be provided to the Bank. The Service Provider obtain the Bank’s consent (such consent should not be unreasonably withheld) before amending such policies, procedures and control measures.

This Collaboration Agreement is made and entered into at Mumbai and on this ________ day of __________, 2020 (“Effective Date”) hereto amongst:
HDFC BANK LIMITED, a company incorporated under the Companies Act, 1956 and licensed as a bank under the Banking Regulation Act, 1949, having its registered office at Bank House, Senapati Bapat Marg, Lower Parel, Mumbai 400 013, acting through its branch at the location mentioned in Schedule 1 hereto (hereinafter referred to as the “Bank”, which expression shall, unless it be repugnant to the context or meaning, be deemed to include its successors and assigns) of the ONE PART;
AND
SOFTCELL TECHNOLOGIES GLOBAL PRIVATE LIMITED, a Company incorporated  under the Companies Act, 2013 and having its registered office at 303 B-Wing, Commercial-1, Kirol Road, Kohinoor City Phase 1 Rd, Kurla, Mumbai 400070 ( hereinafter referred to as the “Merchant”, which expression shall, unless it be repugnant to the context or meaning, be deemed to include its successors and permitted assigns) of the OTHER PART; 
The Bank and the Merchant shall be individually referred to as a “Party” and collectively as the “Parties”.
WHEREAS:
The Merchant is engaged  in the business of reselling various products and has, inter alia, developed   the Merchant Platform (as defined hereinbelow) for facilitating sale and resale of various products. 
That the Bank has a financial product, through which the Bank extends credit facility on variety of consumer items to the employees of its corporate customers (the “Bank’s Offerings”). 
The Merchant is desirous of expanding its business and with the aforesaid intent approached the Bank for collaboration in regard to the Merchant Platform with the Bank’s Offerings.
After due negotiations, the Parties have agreed to collaborate on a non-exclusive basis to make available for the Target Customers (as defined hereinbelow), who meet the Bank’s credit and other internal parameters and who the Bank determines (in its sole discretion) are eligible for loans, a hassle free way to avail Debit Card EMI and/or pre-approved loan facility solely for the purpose of making whole or part-payment of the Product(s) Price (as hereinafter defined) (as may be applicable) (“Loan(s)”) for  the purchase of the Products from the Merchant Platform, subject to certain terms and conditions;
In this regard, the Merchant wishes to undertake various obligations to the Bank, to enable the Bank to consider giving of and/or grant the Loans to the Target Customers Accordingly, the Parties have agreed to enter into this Agreement.
IT IS NOW AGREED BY AND BETWEEN THE PARTIES HERETO AS UNDER:
RESPONSE TIME AND SEVERITY LEVELS
Payment and Delivery.
Reseller Obligations and Liability.

This Non-Disclosure Agreement (“Agreement”) is entered into as of _______ (“Effective Date”) by and between Trans American Information Systems Private Limited (a Mastek Limited company) a company incorporated under the provisions of Companies Act, 1956 having its registered office at 103, Iris Tech Park, Sector 48, Sohna Road, Gurgaon 120018 (hereinafter referred to as “TAISTech”); and Softcell Technologies Global Private Limited, a company incorporated under the laws of India with Registration No. U74999MH2018PTC313645 having its registered office at 303 B-Wing, Commercial-1 Kohinoor City, Kirol Road, Kurla (W) Mumbai – 400070. (“Vendor”).
WHEREAS hereinafter, TAISTech and Vendor are referred to individually as a “Party” and collectively as the “Parties”.
AND WHEREAS TAISTech may engage Vendor to carry out ________________ (“Purpose”). To accomplish the Purpose of this Agreement and to enable Vendor to carry out the obligations agreed between Vendor and TAISTech, and/or for entering into discussions pertaining to the Purpose, TAISTech may require to share Confidential Information of TAISTech or its affiliates. Parties propose that such disclosure should be subject to the following terms and conditions:
For the purposes of this Agreement, the words “Confidential Information” shall mean all and any information, in any form which is not in the public domain concerning the business and/or finances of TAISTech, its affiliates including without prejudice to the generality of the foregoing, reports, interpretations, forecasts, records, corporate business plans, financial projections, financial details and accounts, products, services, planned products, planned services, marketing and advertising plans, marketing and advertising requirements, budgets, fee levels, customer/client lists, commissions, commission charges, pricing policies, operational data processing capabilities, software, hardware and related specifications, all information about research and development, terms and conditions of the consultancy agreement to be signed between Vendor and TAISTech and terms of this Agreement.  
All such Confidential Information relating to the Purpose furnished by or on behalf of TAISTech (the “Disclosing Party”) to Vendor (the “Receiving Party”) is included as Confidential Information whether furnished before or after the date of this Agreement, and regardless of the manner in which it is furnished. Subject to Receiving Party is able to prove, Information which is not defined as Confidential Information includes information such as:
was already legally in the possession of the Receiving Party prior to the disclosure thereof by the Disclosing Party and is not subject to any obligation of confidentiality; 
at the time of its disclosure to the Receiving Party is public knowledge or subsequently becomes public knowledge other than as a result of some act or omission on the part of the Receiving Party in breach of the terms of this Agreement;
at any time after the date of this Agreement is disclosed to the Receiving Party by a third party who is not under any duty of confidentiality or secrecy to the Disclosing Party in relation thereto; 
is disclosed to the Receiving Party on a non-confidential basis;
is independently developed by employees of the Receiving Party to whom no disclosure of the Confidential Information has been made.
Subject to the provisions at clauses 5, 6 and 8 below, the Receiving Party shall not, without the prior written consent of an authorized representative of the Disclosing Party, communicate or divulge to any third party whomsoever, or make any use of any Confidential Information of the Disclosing Party or any of its clients or customers.  Notwithstanding anything contrary contained herein, Receiving Party hereby unconditionally agree that, Disclosing Party shall be entitled to use Receiving Party’s personal data, Confidential Information (if any) that may be provided to Disclosing Party. Disclosing Party shall be entitled to share such personal data with prospective clients in India and abroad from time to time basis for business purpose.
The Receiving Party agrees that it will keep such Confidential Information in trust and strict confidence for the sole benefit of the Disclosing Party and will take all reasonable measures to protect the Confidential Information and avoid the unauthorised use, disclosure, publication or dissemination of the Disclosing Party’s Confidential Information (such measure in any event to be no less than the degree of care that it uses to protect its own confidential and proprietary information of a similar nature and importance). 
The Receiving Party may disclose the Confidential Information, or any portion thereof, to the Receiving Party’s directors, officers, employees only on a strictly need to know basis, if such disclosure is required for the purpose of evaluating the Purpose, and provided that they agree to treat the Confidential Information in accordance with the terms of this Agreement. Prior to disclosing the Confidential Information, the Receiving Party shall require such personal who needs to know the Confidential Information, to sign definitive non-disclosure agreement with similar or more stringent terms and conditions. Disclosing Party shall have the right to monitor on a continuous basis the use of its Confidential Information by the Receiving Party and its employees/consultants/agents, as the case may be. By giving twenty (24) hour’s notice, the Disclosing Party shall be eligible to enter upon the Receiving Party’s premises and conduct the necessary security audit to satisfy itself the protection of its Confidential Information on the hands of the Receiving Party.
The Receiving Party agrees that it will not use any Confidential Information furnished to it by the Disclosing Party for any other purpose other than to evaluate and/or facilitate the Purpose. Receiving Party confirms that Receiving Party and its employees/consultants are aware of the information security policy and procedures of Disclosing Party and any changes made from time to time and undertakes to keep itself aware of the requirements of such policy and procedures and shall comply with the same.
Receiving Party is fully aware regarding Disclosing Party’s conformity with the law, on the privacy subject. Receiving Party shall always abide by all the requirements and provisions of The Information Technology Act, 2000 as amended and updated till date, with the related rules and regulations. In case of any non-compliance, Receiving Party shall be liable for civil or criminal consequences thereof. Receiving Party shall also abide by all the instructions issued by Disclosing Party from time to time, and in case any violation Receiving Party shall promptly communicate in writing, through the proper channel, to Disclosing Party. 
All Confidential Information furnished to the Receiving Party shall remain the property of the Disclosing Party and nothing contained herein shall be construed as granting the Receiving Party any rights with respect to the Confidential Information disclosed, other than as outlined in this Agreement.
Notwithstanding the provisions of clause 3, the Receiving Party may make disclosure of the Disclosing Party’s Confidential Information as is required by law, by the order of a court, or by any governmental or other regulatory authority, but then only to the extent so required, and provided that:
The Receiving Party will promptly notify the Disclosing Party of the existence, terms and circumstances surrounding the request (unless in doing so the Receiving Party would breach the terms of the subpoena, court order, or a statutory or regulatory obligation upon the Receiving Party); and 
The Receiving Party exercises reasonable efforts to obtain assurance that confidential treatment will be accorded to that portion of the Confidential Information that is being disclosed.
Receiving Party will immediately notify to the Disclosing Party upon discovery of any loss or unauthorised disclosure of the Confidential Information of the Disclosing Party and shall immediately take adequate measure to protect such disclosure.
Immediately upon the written request of the Disclosing Party and in a form acceptable to Disclosing Party, the Receiving Party will return all materials, documents and papers containing Confidential Information supplied to it by the Disclosing Party, together with any copies made of such materials, documents or papers and any other documents which are based upon, contain or otherwise reflect the Confidential Information, or confirm that such Confidential Information has been destroyed.
This Agreement is intended only to facilitate the exchange of Confidential Information and is not intended to be, and shall not be construed to create a teaming agreement, joint venture, association, partnership or other business organisation or agency arrangement and Vendor shall not assign its interest under this Agreement without the prior written consent of TAISTech.
This Agreement embodies the entire agreement and understanding of the parties hereto and supersedes any and all prior agreements, arrangements and understandings, whether oral or written, relating to the matters provided for herein. No alteration, waiver, amendment, change or supplement hereto shall be binding or effective unless the same is set forth in writing signed by authorised person of each Party.
If the Vendor at any point in time become the subject of a merger or any other form of reorganisation or internal reconstruction it is agreed that the successor in law to Vendor shall also be bound by the terms of this Agreement as if such party were an original party hereto.  
No exercise or failure to exercise, or delay in exercising any right, power or remedy vested in TAISTech under or pursuant hereto shall constitute a waiver by TAISTech of that or any other right, power or remedy. 
If it is found in a court of competent jurisdiction that any term or provision hereof is invalid or unenforceable, the Parties agree that the remaining terms and provisions hereof shall be unimpaired and shall remain in full force and effect.
Vendor shall not publicise the fact of this Agreement or the subject matter thereof without the prior written consent of TAISTech.
The term of this Agreement will be of ____ year from the Effective Date. All the provisions of this Agreement shall survive termination or expiry of this Agreement. 
Vendor agrees that, Disclosing Party doesn’t make any representation or warranty, express or implied with respect to the accuracy or completeness of any Confidential Information provided herein under. Disclosing Party shall not be liable and responsible for any direct or indirect damages arising out of Disclosing Party’s breach of any terms and conditions hereof. 
In case of any unauthorized disclosure or breach of the Confidential Information or any of the clauses of this Agreement by the Receiving Party or its employees/consultants, the same shall be notified immediately but not later than 2 working days from the happening of the event by the Receiving Party to the Disclosing Party. In case Disclosing Party becomes aware of any unauthorized disclosure or breach of the Confidential Information or any of the clauses of this Agreement by the Receiving Party or its employees/consultants, the Disclosing Party shall intimate the same to the Receiving Party immediately and demand an explanation from the Receiving Party for the same and shall be entitled to recover any damages and to take any legal action as mentioned herein. Vendor agrees that if any term in this Confidentiality Agreement is breached, or threatened to be breached, a remedy at law may be inadequate and, therefore, without limiting any other remedy available at law or in equity, an injunction, specific performance or other forms of equitable relief or monetary damages or any combination thereof shall be available to TAISTech.  
Vendor agrees and undertake that with effective from Effective Date, they will not solicit directly or indirectly any business or offer any product, services or take up any assignment with TAISTech’s clients or affiliates. Vendor shall further agree and undertake not to solicit or hire any employee of TAISTech for a period of Twenty Four (24) months from the date of termination or expiry of services agreement or this Agreement (whichever is later).  
This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of India, and both Parties hereby irrevocably submit to the exclusive jurisdiction of the courts of Mumbai.
This Agreement may be executed in any number of counterparts, each of such executed copy shall constitute to be an original. 
The Parties acknowledge and agree to be bound by the contents of this Agreement, by executing this Confidentiality Agreement under the hands of their duly authorised officers.
IN WITNESS this Agreement has been executed and delivered by the parties in accordance with the laws of the territory in which it is incorporated on the date first above written.

Following any such Customer acceptance, the Customer will be deemed to have waived any claim against the Company with respect to such Implementation Services/deliverables. Consequently, the Customer agrees that any additional issues and/or requirements identified after such the Customer acceptance will need to be addressed as new requirements and billed to the Customer accordingly.

DATA SECURITY AND PROTECTION:
Service Provider will comply in all respects with the Data Protection Laws and Regulations and will provide such help and cooperation as is reasonably necessary or requested to the other to comply with the same. The Service Provider does not collect the Customer’s personal data. The Service Provider does not assume any responsibility for determining the purposes for which and the manner in which the Customer’s personal data is processed. 
Service Provider will not disclose or share personally identifiable information provided to it by Customer with any third party without Customer’ prior written consent (except as required by law pursuant to a valid governmental request). Service Provider agrees that it will not host, transfer, or access any Customer-provided personally identifiable information outside of the United States.
Billing:

This SLA is not intended to confer any rights or remedies upon any person other than the parties hereto.

The Service Provider shall preserve the Confidential Information in accordance with the legal/regulatory obligations of the Bank subject to confidentiality obligations under this Agreement. Upon reasonable advance written notice, Service Provider shall provide copies of all the Confidential Information including data captured, processed and stored in relation to this Agreement to the Bank and its auditors, attorneys, and representatives and the Bank, its auditors, attorneys, and representatives, shall have the right to inspect/audit all such Confidential Information at the Service Provider’s registered office and/or any other premises. The Service Provider shall ensure the preservation, protection, security and confidentiality of the Confidential Information in its custody. The Service Provider shall return all Confidential Information as and when demanded by the Bank on or termination of this Agreement whichever is earlier. The Service Provider shall be bound by the confidentiality obligations under this Agreement during the Term and after termination of this Agreement.
A copy of the Service Provider’s policies, procedures and control measures should be provided to the Bank. The Service Provider obtain the Bank’s consent (such consent should not be unreasonably withheld) before amending such policies, procedures and control measures.

This Non-Disclosure Agreement (“Agreement”) is entered into as of _______ (“Effective Date”) by and between Trans American Information Systems Private Limited (a Mastek Limited company) a company incorporated under the provisions of Companies Act, 1956 having its registered office at 103, Iris Tech Park, Sector 48, Sohna Road, Gurgaon 120018 (hereinafter referred to as “TAISTech”); and Softcell Technologies Global Private Limited, a company incorporated under the laws of India with Registration No. U74999MH2018PTC313645 having its registered office at 303 B-Wing, Commercial-1 Kohinoor City, Kirol Road, Kurla (W) Mumbai – 400070. (“Vendor”).
WHEREAS hereinafter, TAISTech and Vendor are referred to individually as a “Party” and collectively as the “Parties”.
AND WHEREAS TAISTech may engage Vendor to carry out ________________ (“Purpose”). To accomplish the Purpose of this Agreement and to enable Vendor to carry out the obligations agreed between Vendor and TAISTech, and/or for entering into discussions pertaining to the Purpose, TAISTech may require to share Confidential Information of TAISTech or its affiliates. Parties propose that such disclosure should be subject to the following terms and conditions:
For the purposes of this Agreement, the words “Confidential Information” shall mean all and any information, in any form which is not in the public domain concerning the business and/or finances of TAISTech, its affiliates including without prejudice to the generality of the foregoing, reports, interpretations, forecasts, records, corporate business plans, financial projections, financial details and accounts, products, services, planned products, planned services, marketing and advertising plans, marketing and advertising requirements, budgets, fee levels, customer/client lists, commissions, commission charges, pricing policies, operational data processing capabilities, software, hardware and related specifications, all information about research and development, terms and conditions of the consultancy agreement to be signed between Vendor and TAISTech and terms of this Agreement.  
All such Confidential Information relating to the Purpose furnished by or on behalf of TAISTech (the “Disclosing Party”) to Vendor (the “Receiving Party”) is included as Confidential Information whether furnished before or after the date of this Agreement, and regardless of the manner in which it is furnished. Subject to Receiving Party is able to prove, Information which is not defined as Confidential Information includes information such as:
was already legally in the possession of the Receiving Party prior to the disclosure thereof by the Disclosing Party and is not subject to any obligation of confidentiality; 
at the time of its disclosure to the Receiving Party is public knowledge or subsequently becomes public knowledge other than as a result of some act or omission on the part of the Receiving Party in breach of the terms of this Agreement;
at any time after the date of this Agreement is disclosed to the Receiving Party by a third party who is not under any duty of confidentiality or secrecy to the Disclosing Party in relation thereto; 
is disclosed to the Receiving Party on a non-confidential basis;
is independently developed by employees of the Receiving Party to whom no disclosure of the Confidential Information has been made.
Subject to the provisions at clauses 5, 6 and 8 below, the Receiving Party shall not, without the prior written consent of an authorized representative of the Disclosing Party, communicate or divulge to any third party whomsoever, or make any use of any Confidential Information of the Disclosing Party or any of its clients or customers.  Notwithstanding anything contrary contained herein, Receiving Party hereby unconditionally agree that, Disclosing Party shall be entitled to use Receiving Party’s personal data, Confidential Information (if any) that may be provided to Disclosing Party. Disclosing Party shall be entitled to share such personal data with prospective clients in India and abroad from time to time basis for business purpose.
The Receiving Party agrees that it will keep such Confidential Information in trust and strict confidence for the sole benefit of the Disclosing Party and will take all reasonable measures to protect the Confidential Information and avoid the unauthorised use, disclosure, publication or dissemination of the Disclosing Party’s Confidential Information (such measure in any event to be no less than the degree of care that it uses to protect its own confidential and proprietary information of a similar nature and importance). 
The Receiving Party may disclose the Confidential Information, or any portion thereof, to the Receiving Party’s directors, officers, employees only on a strictly need to know basis, if such disclosure is required for the purpose of evaluating the Purpose, and provided that they agree to treat the Confidential Information in accordance with the terms of this Agreement. Prior to disclosing the Confidential Information, the Receiving Party shall require such personal who needs to know the Confidential Information, to sign definitive non-disclosure agreement with similar or more stringent terms and conditions. Disclosing Party shall have the right to monitor on a continuous basis the use of its Confidential Information by the Receiving Party and its employees/consultants/agents, as the case may be. By giving twenty (24) hour’s notice, the Disclosing Party shall be eligible to enter upon the Receiving Party’s premises and conduct the necessary security audit to satisfy itself the protection of its Confidential Information on the hands of the Receiving Party.
The Receiving Party agrees that it will not use any Confidential Information furnished to it by the Disclosing Party for any other purpose other than to evaluate and/or facilitate the Purpose. Receiving Party confirms that Receiving Party and its employees/consultants are aware of the information security policy and procedures of Disclosing Party and any changes made from time to time and undertakes to keep itself aware of the requirements of such policy and procedures and shall comply with the same.
Receiving Party is fully aware regarding Disclosing Party’s conformity with the law, on the privacy subject. Receiving Party shall always abide by all the requirements and provisions of The Information Technology Act, 2000 as amended and updated till date, with the related rules and regulations. In case of any non-compliance, Receiving Party shall be liable for civil or criminal consequences thereof. Receiving Party shall also abide by all the instructions issued by Disclosing Party from time to time, and in case any violation Receiving Party shall promptly communicate in writing, through the proper channel, to Disclosing Party. 
All Confidential Information furnished to the Receiving Party shall remain the property of the Disclosing Party and nothing contained herein shall be construed as granting the Receiving Party any rights with respect to the Confidential Information disclosed, other than as outlined in this Agreement.
Notwithstanding the provisions of clause 3, the Receiving Party may make disclosure of the Disclosing Party’s Confidential Information as is required by law, by the order of a court, or by any governmental or other regulatory authority, but then only to the extent so required, and provided that:
The Receiving Party will promptly notify the Disclosing Party of the existence, terms and circumstances surrounding the request (unless in doing so the Receiving Party would breach the terms of the subpoena, court order, or a statutory or regulatory obligation upon the Receiving Party); and 
The Receiving Party exercises reasonable efforts to obtain assurance that confidential treatment will be accorded to that portion of the Confidential Information that is being disclosed.
Receiving Party will immediately notify to the Disclosing Party upon discovery of any loss or unauthorised disclosure of the Confidential Information of the Disclosing Party and shall immediately take adequate measure to protect such disclosure.
Immediately upon the written request of the Disclosing Party and in a form acceptable to Disclosing Party, the Receiving Party will return all materials, documents and papers containing Confidential Information supplied to it by the Disclosing Party, together with any copies made of such materials, documents or papers and any other documents which are based upon, contain or otherwise reflect the Confidential Information, or confirm that such Confidential Information has been destroyed.
This Agreement is intended only to facilitate the exchange of Confidential Information and is not intended to be, and shall not be construed to create a teaming agreement, joint venture, association, partnership or other business organisation or agency arrangement and Vendor shall not assign its interest under this Agreement without the prior written consent of TAISTech.
This Agreement embodies the entire agreement and understanding of the parties hereto and supersedes any and all prior agreements, arrangements and understandings, whether oral or written, relating to the matters provided for herein. No alteration, waiver, amendment, change or supplement hereto shall be binding or effective unless the same is set forth in writing signed by authorised person of each Party.
If the Vendor at any point in time become the subject of a merger or any other form of reorganisation or internal reconstruction it is agreed that the successor in law to Vendor shall also be bound by the terms of this Agreement as if such party were an original party hereto.  
No exercise or failure to exercise, or delay in exercising any right, power or remedy vested in TAISTech under or pursuant hereto shall constitute a waiver by TAISTech of that or any other right, power or remedy. 
If it is found in a court of competent jurisdiction that any term or provision hereof is invalid or unenforceable, the Parties agree that the remaining terms and provisions hereof shall be unimpaired and shall remain in full force and effect.
Vendor shall not publicise the fact of this Agreement or the subject matter thereof without the prior written consent of TAISTech.
The term of this Agreement will be of ____ year from the Effective Date. All the provisions of this Agreement shall survive termination or expiry of this Agreement. 
Vendor agrees that, Disclosing Party doesn’t make any representation or warranty, express or implied with respect to the accuracy or completeness of any Confidential Information provided herein under. Disclosing Party shall not be liable and responsible for any direct or indirect damages arising out of Disclosing Party’s breach of any terms and conditions hereof. 
In case of any unauthorized disclosure or breach of the Confidential Information or any of the clauses of this Agreement by the Receiving Party or its employees/consultants, the same shall be notified immediately but not later than 2 working days from the happening of the event by the Receiving Party to the Disclosing Party. In case Disclosing Party becomes aware of any unauthorized disclosure or breach of the Confidential Information or any of the clauses of this Agreement by the Receiving Party or its employees/consultants, the Disclosing Party shall intimate the same to the Receiving Party immediately and demand an explanation from the Receiving Party for the same and shall be entitled to recover any damages and to take any legal action as mentioned herein. Vendor agrees that if any term in this Confidentiality Agreement is breached, or threatened to be breached, a remedy at law may be inadequate and, therefore, without limiting any other remedy available at law or in equity, an injunction, specific performance or other forms of equitable relief or monetary damages or any combination thereof shall be available to TAISTech.  
Vendor agrees and undertake that with effective from Effective Date, they will not solicit directly or indirectly any business or offer any product, services or take up any assignment with TAISTech’s clients or affiliates. Vendor shall further agree and undertake not to solicit or hire any employee of TAISTech for a period of Twenty Four (24) months from the date of termination or expiry of services agreement or this Agreement (whichever is later).  
This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of India, and both Parties hereby irrevocably submit to the exclusive jurisdiction of the courts of Mumbai.
This Agreement may be executed in any number of counterparts, each of such executed copy shall constitute to be an original. 
The Parties acknowledge and agree to be bound by the contents of this Agreement, by executing this Confidentiality Agreement under the hands of their duly authorised officers.
IN WITNESS this Agreement has been executed and delivered by the parties in accordance with the laws of the territory in which it is incorporated on the date first above written.
