This Master Service Agreement is made and entered into on __ day of ____ 2023 (“Effective Date”) by and between:
Softcell Technologies Global Private Limited, is a Service Provider incorporated under the Companies Act 2013 and having its registered office at 303, B-wing, Commercial-1 Kohinoor City, Kirol Road, Kurla(W) Mumbai – 400070 (hereinafter referred to as the “Service Provider”, which expression shall, unless repugnant to the context or meaning thereof, be deemed to mean and include its successors and permitted assigns) of the One Part; 
and
Sirion Labs Private Limited, is a company incorporated under the Companies Act 1956/2013 and having its registered office at 10-B, Sagar Apartments, 6 Tilak Marg, New Delhi - 110001 (hereinafter referred to as the “Customer”, which expression shall, unless repugnant to the context or meaning thereof, be deemed to mean and include its successors and permitted assigns) of the Other Part. 
The Service Provider and the Customer are hereinafter, wherever the context requires, individually referred to as a “Party” and collectively as the “Parties”. 
WHEREAS,
The Service Provider is a leading provider of business-to-business IT infrastructure solutions and is an authorized reseller of the subscription to the OEM Software (as defined below).
Based on the expertise and representation of the Service Provider, the Customer has decided to procure certain licenses for Crowdstrike license (“OEM Software”) from the OEM (as defined below) and is now seeking Services from the Service Provider subject to the terms and conditions pursuant to this Agreement.
NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual promises and covenants set forth herein, and for other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which are hereby acknowledged, the Parties agree as follows.
DEFINITIONS:
Capitalized terms used in this Agreement, will have the definitions assigned below, or as indicated in context. Except as otherwise provided in this Agreement, technical terms commonly used in the industry will be so construed. 
“Agreement” shall mean this Master Service Agreement, including its annexures, amendments, modifications and supplements thereto.
“Confidential information” shall mean all non-public information in oral, written, electronic, optical or other form including any information / data / materials, whether specifically designated as “confidential” or not, which (a) relates to past, present and future research, Intellectual Property Rights, development, business activities, chat history and details, products (prototype or otherwise), software, hardware, trade secrets, services, courses and its materials, discoveries, concepts ,techniques, models, data, documentation, processes, procedures, know-how, marketing techniques and materials, contents, marketing and development plans, business models, customer names, financial information, technical information and information related to customers, vendors, employees, price lists, pricing policies, financial information, trade secrets and  personal data, and technical knowledge, written or verbal or any other electronic form or contained in any media or machine-readable form, and (b) has been identified as confidential or would be understood to be confidential by a reasonable person under the circumstances in which it is disclosed. Confidential Information does not include information that (i) was in the public domain at the time it was disclosed or becomes part of the public domain after disclosure, without breach of this Agreement ; (ii) was known to the  receiving Party  prior to disclosure or becomes known to it from a third party which is legally entitled to disclose it; or (iii) is required to be disclosed under applicable laws and regulations or by competent governmental order or legal process; (iv) was independently developed by the receiving Party without use of the disclosing Party’s Confidential Information. In case the Confidential Information disclosed orally, the Parties shall ensure to reduce the same in writing within 10 days from the date of disclosure.
“Fees” shall mean the fees payable by the Customer to the Service Provider for (i) the purchase of subscription(s) to the Software as per applicable Order and (ii) Implementation Services as per the applicable SOW.
“Implementation Services” shall mean the services rendered for implementation of the OEM Software including any consulting, training services as detailed in the SOW or any other services mutually agreed to be provided by the Service Provider and the OEM to the Customer. 
“Intellectual Property Rights” includes, but all patents, trademarks, ideas, concepts, creations, discoveries, inventions, know-how, permits, service marks, brands, trade names, trade secrets, techniques, methods, processes, proprietary information and knowledge, technology, computer programs, databases, copyrights, licenses, franchises, formulae, designs, data, documents, instruction manuals, records, memoranda, notes, whether or not copyrightable or patentable, or any written or verbal instructions or comments and other Confidential Information.
“IPRs” or “Intellectual Property Rights” shall mean all rights, benefits, title or interest in or to any Intellectual Property, anywhere in the world (whether registered or not and including all applications for the same). 
“Master Service Agreement/MSA” shall mean the this Agreement entered into between the Service Provider and the Customer for  Services of the OEM Software and other documentation entered into between the Service Provider and the Customer excluding any end-user license agreement, which may be entered into by the end user of the Customer with the OEM. 
“OEM” shall Original Equipment Manufacturer and/or any of its affiliates. 
“Order(s)” shall mean a written order, that the Parties may enter into from time to time under this Agreement for the sale and purchase of the subscription(s) to the Software , setting forth the details as to the subscription,  Fees for the subscription(s) to the Software and other terms mutually agreed between the Parties. 
“Reseller Agreement” shall mean the agreement entered into between the OEM and the Service Provider by virtue of which the Service Provider is appointed as a reseller of the OEM, including any schedules, annexures, modifications and supplements thereto. 
“Software” shall mean software, provided on subscription basis by the OEM through the Service Provider as reseller to the Customer, subject to terms and Conditions of this Agreement. 
“Services” shall mean Software and Implementation Services, as enumerated in Annexure A.
“Statement of Work” or “SOW” shall mean the individual document containing the scope of Implementation Services, milestones, deliverables and other details, which has been executed between the Parties pursuant to this Agreement and the format of which is annexed herewith as Annexure B.
“Term” shall have the meaning as ascribed to it clause 13.
SCOPE OF THIS AGREEMENT:
Scope:
Subject to the terms of the Reseller Agreement and subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, the Service Provider hereby agrees to provide Software along with Implementation Services of OEM Software to the Customer.
The Service Provider shall provide the Services and Implementation in accordance with the mutually agreed-upon SOW. The Service Provider shall not commence any Services or Implementation until the applicable Fee has been paid in full.
The Customer acknowledges that:
the access to avail the Services shall be directly available to the Customer as per the MSA as well as the End User License Agreement (“EULA”) signed between OEM and Customer; and the Service Provider is not privy to the terms of the EULA.
The Service Provider acknowledges that:
the regularity and quality of the Services performed shall be the essence of this Agreement.
SERVICES:
For obtaining the Services, the Customer shall sign an SOW with the Service Provider via e-mail to the Service Provider’s designated sales representative. Any SOW shall not be binding on the Service Provider, unless the same is accepted by the Service Provider in writing. 
The Customer shall provide all of the requested information including, without limitation, the identity of Customer, the Customer’s business, and email addresses. All such information must be accurate and complete. 
The Implementation Services shall be provided electronically to the Customer or as per the agreed terms of the SOW, and the same shall be subject to the terms of the MSA.
During the course of the MSA, the Customer may rely or act on business processes, instructions & applications, systems related to the OEM Software and Implementation Services that are owned, designed, licensed, and managed by the Service Provider. The Customer in any case shall not incur any liability for relying and or acting on such business process, instructions, application, systems related to the OEM Software and Implementation Services on account of any defects or inadequacy within the Service Provider’s Implementation Services.
APPROVAL PROCESS FOR IMPLEMENTATION SERVICES:
Approval Process: 
The Service Provider shall ensure to provide the Implementation Services to the satisfaction of the Customer. In the event, Customer delivers objections with respect to the Implementation Services/Deliverables that the Services doesn’t materially conform to the specifications agreed under applicable SOW then the Service Provide shall immediately resolve the reported objections but no later than (five) days from the date of reporting. With respect to the Implementation Services provided to the Customer by the Service Provider, except as otherwise agreed in the applicable SOW, the Customer shall be deemed to have accepted such Implementation Services and deliverables unless, the Customer delivers a written objection specifying how the Implementation Services/deliverables do not materially conform to the specifications agreed under any applicable SOW to the Service Provider within five (5) business days following the date on which the Service Provider notifies the Customer that the Service Provider has completed the Implementation Services/submitted the deliverables outlined in the SOW (“Acceptance Period”). In the event the Customer reports any such objection(s) within the Acceptance Period, the Service Provider shall resolve reported objection(s) in the Services within a mutually agreed time frame, which shall be the sole and exclusive remedy for the Customer. Upon receipt of the corrected Implementation Services/deliverables by the Customer, the timelines as stated under this clause for acceptance shall apply to the delivered Services/deliverables. Following any such Customer acceptance, the Customer will be deemed to have waived any claim against the Company with respect to such Implementation Services/deliverables. Consequently, the Customer agrees that any additional issues and/or requirements identified after such the Customer acceptance will need to be addressed as new requirements and billed to the Customer accordingly.

DATA SECURITY AND PROTECTION:
Service Provider will comply in all respects with the Data Protection Laws and Regulations and will provide such help and cooperation as is reasonably necessary or requested to the other to comply with the same. The Service Provider does not collect the Customer’s personal data. The Service Provider does not assume any responsibility for determining the purposes for which and the manner in which the Customer’s personal data is processed. 
Service Provider will not disclose or share personally identifiable information provided to it by Customer with any third party without Customer’ prior written consent (except as required by law pursuant to a valid governmental request). Service Provider agrees that it will not host, transfer, or access any Customer-provided personally identifiable information outside of the United States.
Billing:

Third-Party Beneficiaries:
This SLA is not intended to confer any rights or remedies upon any person other than the parties hereto.

the Services will be performed (i) in a professional manner with a standard level of care, skill and diligence; (ii) using qualified personnel of required skill, training  experience and qualifications; (iii) in a timely, professional and cost effective manner; (iv) in accordance with Applicable Law and all other regulatory requirements, regulations, notifications/circulars issued by the Reserve Bank of India applicable to the performance of the Services, if any and as conveyed by the Bank; (v) in accordance with all policies and working procedures of the Bank conveyed to the Service Provider;

Force Majeure
If any Party is prevented, restricted, delayed or interfered in the performance of its obligations by reason of: (a) Fire, explosion, cyclone, floods, droughts, earthquakes, epidemics, pandemics; (b) War, revolution, acts of public enemies, blockage or embargo, riots and civil commotion; (c) Any law, Government order, proclamation, ordinance or requirements of any Government or authority or representative of any such Government, including restrictive trade practices or regulations; (d) Strikes, shutdowns or labour disputes which are not instigated for
the purpose of avoiding obligations herein; or (e) Any other unforeseeable circumstances beyond the control of the Party affected and not caused by its act, omission or negligence ("Event of Force Majeure"); then notwithstanding anything herein before contained, the Party affected shall be excused from its performance to the extent such performance relates to prevention, restriction, delay or interference and provided the Party so affected used its best efforts to remove such cause of non-performances, and when removed the Party shall continue performance with the utmost dispatch. The Party shall not be liable for penalty if and to the extent that its delay in performance or other failure to perform its obligations under this agreement is the result of an Event of Force Majeure.
Each of the Parties agrees to give written notice forthwith to the other upon becoming aware of an Event of Force Majeure, and the said notice is to contain details of the circumstances giving rise to the Event of Force Majeure. If the Event of Force Majeure continues for a period of more than 30 (thirty) days, either Party can terminate this Agreement at any time thereafter with written notice to other Party.
Counterparts: This Agreement shall be executed in duplicate, each Party holding only a primary copy of this Agreement.

The Party shall not be liable for penalty if and to the extent that its delay in performance or other failure to perform its obligations under this agreement is the result of an Event of Force Majeure.
Each of the Parties agrees to give written notice forthwith to the other upon becoming aware of an Event of Force Majeure, and the said notice is to contain details of the circumstances giving rise to the Event of Force Majeure. If the Event of Force Majeure continues for a period of more than 30 (thirty) days, either Party can terminate this Agreement at any time thereafter with written notice to other Party.
Counterparts: This Agreement shall be executed in duplicate, each Party holding only a primary copy of this Agreement.

Entire Agreement: This Agreement sets forth the entire understanding and agreement of the Parties as to the subject matter of this Agreement. The terms of this Agreement will govern all Services undertaken by Service Provider for FNF India and shall supersede any terms and conditions given anywhere else, either orally or in writing, in connection with the work to be performed under this Agreement.
Severability: If any provision of this Agreement is held to be invalid or unenforceable for any reason, the remaining provisions will continue in full force without being impaired or invalidated in any way. Service Provider and FNF India agree to replace any invalid provision with a valid provision that most closely approximates the intent and effect of the invalid provision.
Successors and Assigns: Service Provider shall not assign or transfer any of its obligations, arising from this Agreement. FNF India may, as and when required assign its obligations under this Agreement to any third parties. Subject to the foregoing, this Agreement will be binding on and for the benefit of the Parties’ assigns and representatives. FNF India may assign this Agreement to any third party as it may deem fit, without the Service Provider’s prior written consent. 
Headings: Titles or headings to the sections of this Agreement are not part of the terms of this Agreement, but are inserted solely for convenience.
Notices: All notices, requests and other communications under this Agreement must be in writing, and must be mailed by registered or certified mail, postage prepaid and return receipt requested, or delivered by hand to the party to whom such notice is required or permitted to be given, or sent by e-mail. If mailed, any such notice will be considered to have been given three (3) business days after it was mailed, as evidenced by the postmark. If delivered by hand, any such notice will be considered to have been given when received by the party to whom the notice is given, as evidenced by written and dated receipt of the receiving party. 
If to FNF India:
FNF India Private Limited
Umiya Business Bay Tower 2, 6th, 7th and 8th Floor, Cessna Business Park, Outer Ring Road, Bengaluru – 560103
If to Service Provider:
Softcell Technologies Global Private Limited, 
1st  Floor, 16 Haudin Road, Ulsoor, Bengaluru -560042
Use of FNF India Trade Mark:  During the term of this Agreement and thereafter, the Service Provider shall not use FNF India’s trademarks or logo, in connection with any material without the prior written permission of FNF India.
Non-Exclusive Arrangement: Service Provider understands that this Agreement is not an exclusive arrangement and that FNF India may utilize other vendors to deliver services like those provided by Service Provider under this Agreement.
Waiver of General Terms and Condition: No general terms and condition of business of the Service Provider shall apply to this agreement even if FNF India does not explicitly contradict them in individual cases. Therefore, the Service Provider hereby irrevocably waives the right to invoke provision of its general terms and condition of business with regard to his engagement with FNF India. 
Corporate Authority : The persons executing this Agreement on behalf of the parties hereto warrant that (i) such party is duly organized and existing, (ii) they are duly authorized to execute and deliver this Agreement on behalf of said party, (iii) by so executing this Agreement, such party is formally bound to the provisions of this Agreement, and (iv) the entering into this Agreement does not violate any provision of any other Agreement to which said party is bound.

The Service Provider being the only authorized partner in India of Manage Engine product, shall ensure that FNF India gets all required technical assistance and support from Zoho during and post implementation of ME SDP Software.
The Service Provider has also agreed to provide full assistance if any reconfiguration is required and ensure to get the work done in an appropriate manner to the satisfaction of FNF India.

SCOPE OF WORK (SoW)
Softcell shall perform the following support services:
First-level troubleshooting and product upgrades.
Configuration adjustments, including workflow creation, SLA setup, and reporting.
Periodic health checks and support ticket creation with the OEM as required.
Remote Office installation, software, and OS deployment based on Aster’s requirements.
Assistance in meetings for requirements gathering and consulting support.

CALL LOGGING PROCESS
Support requests may be logged as follows:
Email: Requests can be sent to support@softcell.com, copying designated Softcell contacts.
Telephone: +91 80 6600 6700.
Upon receiving a support request, Softcell will initiate issue resolution as per the Field Support Services process.

PAYMENT TERMS
Fees: In consideration of support services, Aster shall pay the agreed fees as set forth in the Statement of Work (SOW).
Advance Payment: Payments are due in advance unless otherwise agreed in writing. Invoices shall be paid within the stipulated period from the invoice date.
Non-Refundable Fees: All fees are non-refundable.
Late Payment: Delayed payments will incur interest at 2% per month on overdue fees until settled. Softcell reserves the right to suspend services for overdue accounts, with services resuming only upon full payment, including accrued interest and any applicable charges.
Tax: Fees are exclusive of all taxes, which shall be the responsibility of Aster.

Taxes. Payments made by you under this Reseller Agreement exclude any taxes or duties payable in respect of the Products and Services in the jurisdiction where the payment is either made or received. To the extent that any such taxes or duties are payable by Posit, you must pay to Posit the amount of such taxes or duties in addition to any fees owed under this Reseller Agreement. Notwithstanding the foregoing, you may have obtained an exemption from relevant taxes or duties as of the time such taxes or duties are levied or assessed. In that case, you will have the right to provide to Posit any such exemption information, and Posit will use reasonable efforts to provide such invoicing documents as may enable you to obtain a refund or credit for the amount so paid from any relevant revenue authority if such a refund or credit is available.

Anti-Bribery. In conformity with the United States Foreign Corrupt Practices Act and the UK Bribery Act and with Posit’s corporate policies regarding foreign business practices, you and your employees and agents will not directly or indirectly make and offer payment, promise to pay, or authorize payment, or offer a gift, promise to give, or authorize the giving of anything of value for the purpose of influencing an act or decision of an official of any government (including a decision not to act) or inducing such a person to use his influence to affect any such governmental act or decision in order to assist Posit in obtaining, retaining, or directing any such business.
Services:
1 The Service Levels are only for the Services as defined in the Proposal.
1 Softcell agrees to invoice Saraswat for the Services. Saraswat agrees to pay Softcell for the Services in accordance with the terms and conditions of the invoice.

Nutanix’s liability for direct damages shall be limited to the fees paid for the Products giving rise to the claim under the applicable Order Document.

Other than the advance, the billing cycle will be monthly and payment would be in advance for the services for the duration of 5 years. The invoice will be raised by Softcell about 30 days prior to the start of the service period.
This will be binding on both the irrespective of any change in ownership of the organisations during the tenure of the contract and both the organisations will provide a declaration by their respective that they are authorised to enter into such an agreement / contract.
For Sarvatra Technologies Pvt. Ltd.	      	For Softcell Technologies Ltd.

clauses.title: IMPORTANT - PLEASE READ CAREFULLY BEFORE YOU SUBMIT AN ORDER FOR PURCHASE OR RESALE
clauses.text:
This Reseller Agreement (the "Reseller Agreement") is between the applicable reseller ("you" or "Reseller"), and Posit Software, PBC (“Posit”) (formerly known as RStudio, PBC). If you are agreeing to this Reseller Agreement not as an individual but on behalf of your company, then "Reseller" or "you" means your company, and you are binding your company to this Reseller Agreement.
This Reseller Agreement permits you to resell subscriptions to Posit products and services (the “Products and Services”) listed on the Order (as defined below in Section 1) entered into by you and
Posit for a particular end user.
This Reseller Agreement is a separate agreement from the agreements that Posit has with its end users of the Products and Services which can be found at the following links (the “Product Agreements”):
Posit End User License Agreement: https://posit.co/about/eula/
Posit Service Terms of Use: https://posit.co/about/posit-service-terms-of-use/
Posit Technical Account Management Program Terms of Service:
https://pos.it/TAM-terms-of-service
Posit Academy Terms of Service: https://pos.it/academy-learning-services-agreement
This Reseller Agreement does not have to be signed in order to be binding. You indicate your assent to the terms by clicking on the "I agree" (or similar button) that is presented to you at the time of your order.
variants:
The Service Provider shall itself perform its obligations under this Agreement and shall not assign, transfer, or sub-contract any of its rights and obligations in relation to all or part of the Services or related thereto. The Service Provider shall appoint sub-contractors and/or assign or transfer any of the rights and obligations under this Agreement with prior written consent of the Bank.  The Service Provider shall at all times remain responsible and liable to the Bank for all the actions of the agents, sub-agents/sub-contractors, assignee, or transferee, as the case may be, with no dilution or diminution of service, controls, penalties, etc.
Notwithstanding anything contrary contained in the terms of this Agreement, Service Provider shall ensure that such agents, sub-agent, sub-contractor, assignee or transferee etc. shall be bound by the terms of this Agreement. For the purpose of this clause and notwithstanding any such written consent being given by the Bank, the Service Provider shall remain liable for the acts and omissions of any delegate it has delegated its activities to i.e. sub agent, sub-contractor, agent etc. If such delegation is as a result of operation of any laws, then Bank shall have an option on such delegation to immediately terminate this Agreement at its discretion. The Service Provider shall be responsible and liable for the performance and risk management practices of its sub-contractors. 
The Bank shall be entitled to assign/transfer part/ all of its rights and benefits under this Agreement/this Agreement to any Person or entity without any prior notice or intimation to the Service Provider. However, the Service Provider shall not transfer or assign this Agreement and/or any obligations or rights under this Agreement to any third party without prior written consent of the Bank.
BUSINESS CONTINUITY PLAN (“BCP”)
The Service Provider hereby confirms that it has developed and established a robust framework for documenting, maintaining and testing business continuity and recovery procedures and the same are tested periodically and agrees to test such business continuity and recovery plan jointly with the Bank and shall ensure that the Service to the Bank would not be adversely affected in any manner on account of any factors including system breakdowns which may cause disruption in the normal functions of the Service Provider.
The Service Provider hereby agrees and understands that Services to be performed under this Agreement shall continue to be offered under ordinary circumstances. In the event of any difficulty in performing the required Services, Service Provider shall make best efforts to make alternative arrangements to ensure that the required Services are continued to be performed.
The Service Provider shall review and test its BCP on an annual basis and notify the Bank of any substantial changes to its BCP. The test shall validate the functionality and effectiveness of the BCP, including but not limited to the feasibility of the recovery time objectives, recovery point objectives and resumption operation capacities.
Following each test the Service Provider shall confirm to the Bank the functionality and effectiveness of the BCP. The Service Provider shall promptly notify the Bank of any test findings that may affect the Service Provider’s performance of its Services. The Service Provider shall promptly implement remedial measures or actions to address the test findings, including those required by the Bank.
Upon the Bank’s request, the Service Provider shall participate in the Bank’s business continuity and disaster recovery exercises in respect of the Services to be provided by the Service Provider.
The Service Provider shall, on request, provide copies of results of any independent assessments of such Business Continuity Plan to the Bank.

4 	Audit and Inspection: The RBI and/or legal/ regulatory authority of the Bank, RBI including NPCI shall be entitled to inspect or audit directly and/or through its external/internal auditors, employees etc. the books, transaction records/transactions, operations, systems, Relevant Premises, Relevant Personnel, Relevant Records, software, IT infrastructure,  and the business records and/or any other information of the Service Provider and/or the sub-contractors which pertains to provision of the Services. The Service Provider shall and shall ensure that the sub-contractor shall permit the RBI, Bank/legal/regulatory authority including NPCI its internal/external auditors, employees etc., the Bank’s regulators and regulators’ officials to inspect, examine and audit and to take copies of the Service Provider’s operations, books, transaction records/transactions,  systems, Relevant Premises, Relevant Personnel, Relevant Records, software, the business records audit reports, reviews, findings and/or any other information, which pertain to provision of the Services under this Agreement. The Bank would give prior written notice of  () days for such audit. However, no such notice shall be required from legal/regulatory authority, RBI including NPCI. The Service Provider shall and shall ensure that its sub-contractor shall also cooperate in good faith with the Bank for such audit and inspection and to correct any practices which are found to be deficient as a result of any such audit within a reasonable time after receipt of the Banks audit/ inspection report from Bank, RBI, legal/regulatory authority including NPCI.  
The Service Provider shall immediately comply with any request from the Bank and/or any regulatory/legal authority/RBI including NPCI, to submit any reports on the security and control environment of the Service Provider and its sub-contractor in relation to the Services (including without limitation reports on confidentiality, security adequacy and compliance in respect of the operations of the Service Provider and its sub-contractor). The Service Provider shall obtain certifications in relation to the cloud and other software related services as and when requested by the Bank to ensure that the Bank is in compliance with the legal / regulatory authority. 
For the purpose of this Clause 15:
“Relevant Premises” means any premises in the possession or control of the Service Provider or agents or any sub-contractor from which the Services are delivered (in whole or in part) or in which records relating to the services are kept.
“Relevant Personnel” means all employees, staff, other workers, agents, sub-contractors and consultants of the Service Provider or any sub-contractor who are engaged in the provision of the Services from time to time. 
“Relevant Records” shall include but not limited to any information and documents in relation to this Agreement, Confidential Information, systems and software, transaction information, any records in relation to this Agreement in soft and hard form, any digitized information. 
The scope of audit under this clause shall include without limitation the Service Provider’s and sub-contractor’s security environment (both physical and IT), control environment, incident management process (for material breaches, security disruptions or other material issues), and compliance with risk management requirements set out in this Agreement (including without limitation, the Service Provider’s BCP (as defined above).

MISCELLANOEUS
Governing Law: This Agreement shall be governed by laws of India.
Jurisdiction: This Agreement shall be subject to the exclusive jurisdiction of the courts of Mumbai, Maharashtra, India.
Entire Agreement: This Agreement and any documents referred to in it contain the entire agreement between the Parties and supersede any prior agreements, representations or communications, written or oral, amongst them relating to its subject matter. Amendments may be made to this Agreement at any time, if mutually agreed upon in writing.
Partial Invalidity: If any provision of this Agreement or the application thereof to any Person or circumstance shall be invalid or unenforceable to any extent for any reason including by reason of any Applicable Law, the remainder of such provision and/or this Agreement and the application of such provision to persons or circumstances other than those which are held to be invalid or unenforceable, shall not be affected thereby, and each remaining provision of this Agreement shall be valid and enforceable to the fullest extent permitted by Applicable Law. Any invalid or unenforceable provision of this Agreement shall be replaced with a provision, which is valid and enforceable and most nearly reflects the original intent of the invalid and unenforceable provision.
No Third Party Beneficiaries: No provision of this Agreement is intended to, or shall, confer any third party beneficiary or other rights or remedies upon any person other than the parties hereto, nor impose any obligations on the part of the parties to this Agreement towards any third parties.
Non-Disparagement: Each Party shall refrain from making any written or oral statements to any Person which may be expected to impugn or degrade the character, integrity, or ethics of the other Party and/or its affiliates, directors, officers, agents, employees or clients, or which may reasonably be expected to damage the business, image or reputation of the other Party and/or its affiliates, directors, officers, agents, employees or clients.
Notices: Any amendment, notice, or other communication under this Agreement shall be sent by personal delivery or courier or email or by registered mail/post to the Parties at their respective addresses set forth below (or at such other address as a Party may previously have notified the other Party in accordance with this Clause): 
To Service Provider:
Address: 	
Attn: 		
Email:		
Contact Details: 
To Bank:
Address: 	[●]
Attn: 		[●]
Email:		[●]
Contact Details: [●]
Waiver: The failure to exercise or delay in exercising a right or remedy provided by this Agreement or by law does not constitute a waiver of the right or remedy or the waiver of other rights or remedies. No single or partial exercise of a right or remedy provided by this Agreement or by law prevents further exercise of the right or remedy or the exercise of another right or remedy. Any waiver must be in writing and signed by the Party sought to be bound.
Force Majeure: Notwithstanding anything contained in this Agreement, in the event of this Agreement or any part thereof being rendered wholly or partially impossible of performance by either Party for any reason beyond its reasonable control, including but not limited to outbreak of any pandemic and/or epidemic (except for the Covid-19 pandemic), fire, flood, casualty, lockout, strike, labour disputes, industrial action of any kind, unavoidable accident, or, national calamity or riot, Act of God, the enactment of any Act of Parliament or the act of any other legally constituted authority, or any cause or event arising out of or attributable to war, or any other similar cause or event outside the control of the Parties hereto, then such non-performance shall not be deemed to constitute a breach of this Agreement therein and shall not be liable to pay any damages. The Party affected by Force Majeure shall take steps as are reasonably necessary to remove the causes resulting in force majeure if within its control and to mitigate the effect thereof. 
Survival: The provisions of this Agreement, which by their nature are intended to survive the termination or expiration of this Agreement, including without limitation, Clause 8 (Indemnification and Limitation of Liability), Clause 9 (Confidentiality) and Clause 10 (Intellectual Property Rights and Ownership).
Counterparts: This Agreement may be executed in one or more counterparts, each of which when so executed and delivered shall be deemed an original but all of which together shall constitute one and the same instrument and any Party may execute this Agreement by signing any one or more of such originals or counterparts. The delivery of signed counterparts by facsimile transmission or electronic mail in “portable document format” (“.pdf”) shall be as effective as signing and delivering the counterpart in person.
Specific Performance: The Service Provider agree that damages may not be an adequate remedy and that the Bank shall be entitled to an injunction, restraining order, right for recovery, suit for specific performance or such other equitable or relief as a court of competent jurisdiction may deem necessary or appropriate to restrain the Service Provider from committing any violation or enforce the performance of the covenants, representations and obligations contained in this Agreement. These injunctive remedies are cumulative and are in addition to any other rights and remedies that the Bank may have at Applicable Law, including a right for damages.
Relationship: This Agreement is on principal to principal basis and nothing herein contained shall be deemed to create any employment, partnership, joint venture between the Bank and the Service Provider or their representatives and employees and nothing herein shall be deemed to confer on any Party any authority to incur any obligation or liability on behalf of the other Party. All Representatives, employees, workers, consultants and any other personnel engaged by the Service Provider to render the Services to the Bank shall be in the sole employment of Service Provider and Service Provider shall be solely responsible for their acts, omissions, salaries, wages, statutory payments, social benefits, social security, insurance, social benefits and the like. Under no circumstances shall the Bank be liable for any payment or claim or compensation of any nature to such Representatives, employees, workers and consultants at any point of time during the Term of this Agreement or even after its termination.
Cost and Expenses: Each of the Parties hereto shall pay their respective costs and expenses relating to this Agreement unless otherwise provided herein.
Amendments: This Agreement may not be amended, modified or supplemented except by a written instrument mutually agreed between and executed by each of the Parties. 
Non-Exclusivity: Nothing in this Agreement will restrict either Party’s right to enter into similar or identical arrangements as contemplated in this Agreement with any third party. 
Stamp Duty: The Service Provider is liable for and shall pay all stamp duties, levies, on this Agreement.

The Parties hereby undertake and agree to maintain the confidentiality of the Confidential Information and undertake not to disclose such Confidential Information to any third party except with the prior written consent of the other Party, unless such disclosure is required under law or upon receiving an order of a governmental, judicial or regulatory authority. The Parties further undertake to take the same steps to maintain the confidentiality of the Confidential Information as it would to protect its own confidential information.
Each Party agrees to hold secret and protect the other Party's Confidential Information and use that degree of care that it uses or would use with respect to its own proprietary and confidential information to keep the Confidential Information secret.
Notwithstanding the foregoing, either Party may disclose Confidential Information of the other Party which is: (i) already publicly known, (ii) discovered or created by the receiving Party without reference to the Confidential Information of the disclosing Party, as shown in records of receiving Party, (iii) otherwise known to the receiving Party through no wrongful conduct of the receiving Party, (iv) required to be disclosed by law or court order, provided that Party to whom such order is issued provides the other Party reasonable advance notice of its intended disclosure. Each Party hereby acknowledges that disclosure of the Confidential Information by it or breach of the provisions contained herein may give rise to irreparable injury to the other Party and such breach or disclosure may be inadequately compensable in money damages. Accordingly, each Party may seek injunctive relief against the breach or threatened breach of the foregoing undertakings.
Neither Party shall disclose the terms of this Agreement to any third party other than its affiliates and their legal counsel and accountants without the other Party's prior written consent.
The confidentiality obligations in respect of each such Confidential Information shall survive for a period of two years from the date of expiry / termination of the Agreement, except if required under Applicable Law for a longer period.

In this Agreement, the following words have the meanings set opposite them unless the context indicates otherwise –
[“Affiliates” shall mean a person or entity directly or indirectly controlling, controlled by or under common control of a Party.]       
OR
[“Affiliates” shall mean any person, whether de jure or de facto, which directly or indirectly owns, is owned by or is under common ownership with either Party to the extent of at least twenty-six percent (26%) of the equity having the power to vote on or direct the affairs of the entity, and any person, firm, partnership, corporation or other entity actually controlled by, controlling or under common control with such Party.]

“Applicable Laws” shall mean any statute, law, regulation, ordinance, rule, judgment, order, protocols, notification, circular, decree, bye-law, approval, government resolution, order, directive, guideline, policy, requirement, or other governmental restriction or any similar form of decision of, or determination by, or any interpretation or adjudication having the force of law of any of the foregoing, by any governmental or judicial or regulatory or similar authority having jurisdiction over the matter in question.
“Best Industry Practice” refers to the exercise of the highest degree of skill, care, prudence, efficiency, foresight and timeliness as would be expected from a leading company within the relevant industry or business sector.
“Change Proposal” means the written change proposal signed by both Parties for the purpose of any modification or amendment to the relevant SOW by any addition to the scope of services or otherwise, in accordance with Clause 3.2. The Change Proposal shall be incorporated by reference and form a part of the SOW that it amends.
“Confidential Information” means any and all proprietary or confidential data or information relating to either Party, disclosed (directly or indirectly) by one Party to the other Party, including but not limited to, the terms and conditions of this Agreement and/or any and all financial, technical, non-technical information, data, business operations, future products, on-going research, or business, sales, subscribers, suppliers, clients, employees, ideas and creative works belonging to either Party (regardless of whether such information is protectable under copyright, patent or trademark and/or trade secret doctrine) including but not limited to copyright, trade secret and proprietary information, data, techniques, business forecasts, research, work in progress, program formats, projects, sales and marketing plans, future development, personnel information, whether in oral, written, graphic or electronic form, and whether designated as confidential or not.
However, Confidential Information shall not include the following:
Confidential Information which is now in or hereafter comes into the public domain otherwise than as a result of a breach of the confidentiality obligations in this Agreement;
Confidential Information which, before any negotiations or discussions leading to this Agreement were already known by the receiving Party and was obtained or acquired in circumstances under which the receiving Party was not bound by any form of confidentiality obligation;
Confidential Information which is required by law or regulation to be disclosed to any person who is authorised by law or regulation to receive the same (after consultation, if practicable, with the disclosing Party to limit disclosure to such authorised person to the extent necessary).
“Control” shall have the meaning assigned to it in the Companies Act, 2013 of India.
“Effective Date” for this Agreement shall be .
“Indemnified Persons” refers to ICICI Bank, [its Affiliates] and [their respective/its]directors, employees, representatives, contractors, consultants, agents, successors or assigns.
“Intellectual Property” means and includes all forms of intellectual property rights subsisting under any law or equity and all analogous rights subsisting under the laws of all jurisdictions and shall include Software, any product or process of the human intellect whether registerable or non-registerable, including inter alia, patents, trademarks, copyrights, discoveries, inventions, permits or derivative works of the same expression or literary creation, unique name, trade secret (including ideas, concepts, research and development, compositions, designs, drawings), presentation, instruction manuals, records, memoranda, database rights (including rights of extraction) and all applications, all service marks, logos and trade names, together with all translations, adaptations, derivations, and combinations thereof, and all applications, registrations, and renewals in connection therewith, etc.
“Intellectual Property Rights” include all rights, benefits, title or interest in or to any Intellectual Property, anywhere in the world (whether registered or not and including all applications for the same).
“Materials” shall mean any material including but not limited to all information, reports, studies, software (including source codes, object codes, derivative works and executables) flowcharts, diagrams, hardware and other tangible and intangible material of any nature whatsoever and Intellectual Property.
“RBI” shall mean the Reserve Bank of India. 
“Service Level” shall mean quantitative levels of performance of the Services as set forth in the relevant SOW.
“Services” means the services described in the SOW or under this Agreement and agreed to be rendered by the Service Provider, subject to the terms and conditions herein.
“Sites” means locations designated by ICICI Bank and which are more particularly stated in SOW.
“Software” means such software as identified in the SOW and shall include relevant Update and Upgrades of the Software which is developed or acquired by ICICI Bank [and/or its Affiliates].
“Statement of Work” or “SOW” means the written statement of work signed by both the Parties from time to time (the format for which has been attached to this Agreement as Annexure I), incorporating details of the Services to be rendered by the Service Provider and the scope thereof, the service levels in respect of the Services to be adhered to and the Service Fees and payment terms. 
“Support Team” means the Service Provider’s personnel, employees, contractors, agents or consultants to be deployed at the Sites.
“Termination Assistance” shall have the meaning ascribed to it under Clause 23.1.
“Transaction Documents” means and includes this Agreement, instruments, undertakings, indentures, deeds, writings and other documents, executed or entered into, or to be executed or entered into, by the Service Provider and ICICI Bank or as the case may be, any other person, in relation, or pertaining to the transactions contemplated by, or pursuant to the Transaction Documents, and each such Transaction Documents as amended from time to time.
“Update” shall mean the versions including all future enhancements and/or revisions, bug fixes, error corrections, enhancements and other modifications to the Software being a version which contains such differences from the previous versions and provided to ICICI Bank, at no additional cost to ICICI Bank.
“Upgrade” shall mean a new version of the existing Software that offers a significant change or improvement over the current version and provided at no additional cost to ICICI Bank.
“Virus” shall mean anything or device (including any software, code, file or programme) which may prevent, impair or otherwise adversely affect the operation of any computer software, hardware or network, any telecommunications service, equipment or network or any other service or device; prevent, impair or otherwise adversely affect access to or the operation of any programme or data, including the reliability of any programme or data (whether by re-arranging, altering or erasing the programme or data in whole or part or otherwise); or adversely affect the user experience, including worms, trojan horses, viruses and other similar things or devices.
“Vulnerability” shall mean and include a weakness, whether in the computational logic (for example code) or in the security procedures or practices found in the software and hardware components that, when exploited, results in a negative impact including but not limited to confidentiality, integrity or availability of the Services.

Words importing persons or parties shall include firms and corporations and any organizations having legal capacity.
Words importing the singular include the plural and vice versa.
The headings and titles in this Agreement are for reference only and shall not affect the interpretation or construction hereof.
Reference to the words “include” or “including” shall be construed without limitation.
Any reference to “writing” shall include printing, typing, facsimile, lithography, transmissions by facsimile or in electronic form (including email) and other means of reproducing words in visible form but shall exclude text messages via mobile phones.
References to this Agreement include any SOW, Recitals and Annexures to it and references to Clauses, Annexure are to the clauses of, and annexures to, this Agreement. References to paragraphs are to paragraphs of the Annexures. 
Reference to this Agreement or any other agreement, instrument, or document shall be construed as a reference to this Agreement or such other agreement, instrument, or document as the same may from time to time be amended, varied, supplemented or novated in accordance with the terms of such document.
Any reference to books, records or other information means books, records or other information in any form including, without limitation, paper, electronically stored data, magnetic media, film and microfilm. 
Reference to any statute or statutory provision shall include: (i) any previous legislation or statute relating to that statute or statutory provision to the extent applicable under the relevant Clause or Annexure; (ii) any subordinate legislation, rules and regulations under the specific statute or statutory provision framed from time to time; and (iii) such statute or provision as may be amended, modified, repealed, re-enacted or consolidated.
Reference to Applicable Law shall include laws as may from time to time be enacted amended, supplemented, or re-enacted.
In the event of any disagreement or dispute between the Parties, regarding the materiality or reasonableness of any matter as set out in the Agreement including of any event, occurrence, circumstance, change, fact, information, document, authorization, proceeding, act, omission, claims, breach, default or otherwise, the opinion of ICICI Bank, as to the materiality or reasonableness of any of the foregoing shall prevail.
Time is of essence in the performance of Parties’ respective obligations.

ICICI Bank may, by giving written notice to the Service Provider at any time during the Term, request a change to the Services (“Change Request”).
On receipt of a Change Request from ICICI Bank, the Service Provider shall provide ICICI Bank with a Change Proposal in the format specified under Annexure II, which shall consist of a written estimate of:
any increase or decrease in the price payable to effect such change;
brief details of the likely impact, if any, of the Change Request on any existing Services; 
statement of the cost of the implementation and/or ongoing operation of the relevant change, including any increase of or reduction in the fees or additional fees payable for the proposed change; and
a timeline for the implementation, together with any proposals for acceptance, of the Change Request.
[Notwithstanding the other provisions of this Clause 3, if any changes are necessary to respond to an emergency situation that will materially affect the provision of the Services or the Software, and ICICI Bank believes it is not reasonably practical to agree to the contents of that change in advance in accordance with the foregoing provisions, then:
ICICI Bank will notify the Service Provider of the need for an urgent change;
the Service Provider will immediately or as soon as reasonably practicable make that change; and 
the Service Provider will document the change as soon as possible.]
The timelines pertaining to the acceptance, rejection, implementation (if any) with respect to a Change Request shall be detailed in the relevant SOW.

The Service Provider shall comply with the requirements contained under the relevant SOW on Service Levels. Service Levels and the mechanisms to baseline and measure them will be defined in under the relevant SOW and will be effective and enforced from the commencement date of the Services as specified under the relevant SOW.
Service Levels are priority levels assigned to any issues including but not limited to interruptions, delays, and errors affecting the functionality of the Software (collectively, "Errors") based on urgency, number of users affected, type and extent of service disrupted and availability of a workaround or fall-back. When an Error is communicated to the Service Provider, ICICI Bank shall assign the severity level of the Error based on the severity definitions listed below. ICICI Bank reserves the right to re-classify the severity levels if the needs arise.
If, for any reason, the Service Provider is not able to perform the Services, or meet the agreed standards and service levels as specified under the relevant SOW, the Service Provider shall:
notify ICICI Bank immediately of such failure;
deploy all additional resources and take all remedial action that is necessary to rectify or to prevent the failure of the Service Level from recurring.
within 3 (three) business days or any other timeline more particularly identified in the SOW, the Service Provider will be required to perform and provide to ICICI Bank a root-cause analysis for any incident that would contribute to the Service Provider missing a service level.
If there is a failure of Service Levels, the Service Provider shall pay or credit to the Service Provider service level credits in accordance with the relevant SOW in recognition of the diminished value of the Services resulting from the Service Provider’s failure to meet the agreed upon level of performance. 
Service Level Review: The Service Provider, on a  basis, will be responsible for implementing and operating all measurement and monitoring tools and procedures required by ICICI Bank to measure and report its performance relative to the applicable Service Levels The Service Level measurement, monitoring and reporting process will be subject to audit from time to time as required by ICICI Bank. Both Parties will meet once in a to review the performance in relation to Service Levels. Any revisions, deletions or additions to the Service Levels will be decided mutually between the Parties.

ICICI Bank Materials:
ICICI Bank shall be the sole and exclusive owner of the following (collectively referred to as “ICICI Bank Materials”) and Service Provider shall obtain no right, title or interest herein:
All Materials owned by ICICI Bank as of Effective Date and thereafter;
All Materials acquired by/licensed to ICICI Bank from third parties before or after Effective Date;
All Materials developed by the Service Provider or its subcontractors (including Materials jointly developed with ICICI Bank) under the Agreement and all modifications, enhancements and derivative works of such Materials.
ICICI Bank may grant to the Service Provider a limited, non-exclusive license during the Term to use, operate, access, copy, maintain, modify, enhance and create derivative works of ICICI Bank Materials for the sole purpose of providing the Services. However, all such modified, enhanced, derivative work of the ICICI Bank Materials shall be exclusive property of ICICI Bank and the Service Provider shall have no claim over the same. 
Upon prior written confirmation of ICICI Bank and subject to terms therein, the Service Provider may use ICICI Bank Materials only for the purpose of discharging its obligations under this Agreement or SOW and may not sublicense any rights with respect to ICICI Bank Materials.
Service Provider Materials:
The Service Provider will retain all rights in and shall be the exclusive owner of Materials independently developed and/or owned by the Service Provider outside the scope of Services under this Agreement and SOW, and used by the Service Provider in connection with the Services (“Service Provider Materials”). Service Provider shall seek prior written permission from ICICI Bank to introduce the same for the Services under this Agreement. 
The Service Provider will describe its procedure for the use of Service Provider Materials for the Services to be provided to ICICI Bank under the Agreement and/ or SOW.
Upon introduction of any Service Provider Materials in providing the Services, the Service Provider will grant ICICI Bank [and its Affiliates], at no additional fee or cost, a non-exclusive, sub-licensable, world-wide, irrevocable, perpetual license to use, operate, copy, maintain, modify, enhance and create derivative works of such Materials.
Third Party Materials:
The Service Provider shall seek prior written approval from ICICI Bank to introduce any third-party Materials in connection with the Services.

The Service Provider shall give ICICI Bank months prior written notice, should it decide to discontinue any of the Services detailed in the relevant SOW and the Parties shall mutually agree on the steps to be undertaken as a result of such discontinuation of Services detailed in the relevant SOW.
The Service Provider shall comply with the terms and conditions specified in this Agreement and all other Transaction Documents and also ensure compliance with the Transaction Documents by its personnel and relevant persons who are party to, or have executed or furnished, the Transaction Documents.
The Service Provider shall adhere to the Best Industry Practice in the performance of the Services.
The Service Provider shall segregate and keep separately all information, documents, properties, assets, monies and records pertaining to the Services, ICICI Bank and customers of ICICI Bank and also hold the same in trust for ICICI Bank and customers of ICICI Bank.
The Service Provider shall exercise the same high standard of care in the provision of Services as would be exercised by ICICI Bank if the activities were conducted within ICICI Bank and not outsourced.
The Service Provider shall, at its own costs, undertake all repair, replacement, upgradation or procurement of equipment and infrastructural facilities necessary for the provision of Services.
The Service Provider shall regularly provide updates to ICICI Bank with respect to the provision of the Services and shall meet with the officials designated by ICICI Bank to discuss and review the performance of the Service Provider at such intervals as may be agreed between the Parties.
The Service Provider shall preserve and maintain the documents, data and records in relation to the Services in accordance with the Applicable Laws and as per directions of ICICI Bank in writing in this regard. The Service Provider shall furnish all such records, data and documents as may be required by ICICI Bank.
The Service Provider shall 
comply with all applicable laws, regulations, legal and statutory requirements related to anti-bribery and anti-corruption including but without limitation to the Prevention of Corruption Act, 1988, of India, Foreign Corrupt Practices Act (FCPA) in the United States of America and UK Bribery Act, 2010 of United Kingdom, as any of the foregoing may be amended or enacted from time to time (“Anti-Corruption Laws”)
notify, in writing, ICICI Bank, of all incidents of fraud, bribery (including Anti-Corruption Laws), suspicious transactions including fraudulent / suspicious currency transactions immediately upon occurrence of such incidents.
The Service Provider warrants and agrees that it shall not, [and shall cause its Affiliates not to,]  make, offer, promise, or authorize any unlawful payment or give, offer, promise, or authorize the giving of anything of value to any official, officer, employee, or representative of, or any  person acting in an official capacity for or on behalf of, any government or governmental authority, or any candidate for political office (each, a “Government Official”) for the purpose of influencing any act or decision of such Government Official in connection with the Agreement, and that neither it [nor any of its Affiliates] have done so.
The Service Provider shall, forthwith upon any change in the constitutional documents of the Service Provider, inform ICICI Bank of such change and provide such details in respect of the change and its effect, as may be required by ICICI Bank.

ICICI Bank shall have a paramount charge, lien and right of set off on all monies payable, to the Service Provider or standing to the credit of the Service Provider with ICICI Bank or any of Affiliates of ICICI Bank against all or any sums which the Service Provider is liable to pay under this Agreement and/or the other Transaction Documents or in respect of any other arrangement entered into by the Service Provider with ICICI Bank. In the event that there remains any amount due from the Service Provider to ICICI Bank under the Agreement or otherwise, the monies payable to the Service Provider or standing to the credit of the Service Provider shall be applied first towards the outstanding amount owed by the Service Provider to ICICI Bank under the Agreement, the Transaction Documents or any other agreement or facilities and the Service Provider consents, confirms and agrees to execute all such documents in this regard.
ICICI Bank and the RBI or persons authorised by the RBI, shall at all times during the tenure of the Agreement, be entitled to access the Service Provider’s documents, records of transactions, and other necessary information given to, stored or processed by the Service Provider.
The rights available to ICICI Bank under the Agreement and the other Transaction Documents may be exercised by ICICI Bank either by itself or through such other persons as it may nominate, designate or specify from time to time.

Service Provider shall maintain plans for business continuity, disaster recovery, and backup capabilities and facilities designed to ensure Service Provider’s continued performance of its obligations under this Agreement, including, without limitation, loss of production, loss of systems, loss of equipment, failure of carriers and the failure of Service Provider’s or its supplier’s equipment, computer systems or business systems (“Business Continuity Plan”). 
Such Business Continuity Plan shall be reviewed and updated as suggested by ICICI Bank from time to time. The Service Provider shall test the Business Continuity Plan as specified in the relevant SOW or as specified by ICICI Bank from time to time. 
The Business Continuity Plan shall include, but shall not be limited to, testing, accountability and corrective actions designed to be promptly implemented, if necessary. In addition, in the event that Service Provider has knowledge of an incident affecting the integrity or availability of such Business Continuity Plan, then Service Provider shall, as promptly as practicable, but no later than as advised by ICICI Bank in writing (or sooner to the extent required by Applicable Law) after Service Provider becomes aware of such incident, notify ICICI Bank in writing of such incident and provide the ICICI Bank with updates, as deemed appropriate by Service Provider under the circumstances, with respect to the status of all related remediation efforts in connection with such incident. 
The Service Provider represents that, as of the date of this Agreement, such Business Continuity Plan is active and functioning normally in all respects.
ICICI Bank shall be entitled to intervene and take such appropriate measures (including appointing another person to provide the Services or the possibility of bringing the outsourced activity back in-house) in the event the performance of the Services by the Service Provider are interrupted for any reasons whatsoever.

Commencing at the beginning of any applicable Termination Assistance Period, if requested by ICICI Bank, the Service Provider shall at no additional cost to ICICI Bank provide services that are reasonably required to allow the Services to continue without interruption. Such provision shall include the facilitation of the orderly transfer of the Services to ICICI Bank or any of its nominees, assistance as described under this Clause 23, and any additional requirements as may be necessary (“Termination Assistance”).

The Service Provider acknowledges that, in the event it breaches (or attempts or threatens to breach) its obligation to provide Termination Assistance as provided in this Clause 23, ICICI Bank and its Affiliates will be irreparably harmed. In such an event, ICICI Bank may proceed directly to court to obtain the appropriate equitable remedies, including any appropriate order for specific performance.
Objectives: The purpose of Termination Assistance is:
to enable the Service Provider to cease providing the Services or such part thereof which are to be terminated, and for ICICI Bank or its nominee, from the expiry of the Termination Assistance Period, to undertake services in substitution (the “Replacement Services”); and
to eliminate or minimise any disruption or deterioration of the Services, or failure to achieve the Service Levels, during and as a result of the handover from the Service Provider and the commencement of the Replacement Services.
The timelines, process, and procedure for Termination Assistance shall be detailed in the relevant SOW.
The Service Provider agrees that the provisions of this Clause shall not limit or restrict nor shall they preclude ICICI Bank from pursuing such further and other legal actions, against the Service Provider for any breach or non-compliance of the terms of this Agreement.

The Service Provider shall treat as confidential all Confidential Information of ICICI Bank supplied under this Agreement. The Service Provider shall not divulge any such Confidential Information to any person except to its own employees, sub-contractors, and consultants who need to know it solely for the purpose of performing their obligations or providing the Services under this Agreement.
The Service Provider shall execute appropriate agreements with each such employee, sub-contractor, and consultant that contain obligations detailed in this Clause and is in a form and manner approved or acceptable to ICICI Bank.
The Service Provider acknowledges and agrees that it is aware of the sensitivity and banking secrecy obligations of ICICI Bank in keeping the customer information and transaction records confidential and shall ensure that neither the Service Provider nor any of its employees, sub-contractors, and consultant will do any act violating the same.
The Service Provider will, at all times, maintain confidentiality regarding the contents of this Agreement and any business, technical or financial information that is, at the time of disclosure, designated in writing as confidential, or would be understood by Parties, exercising reasonable and prudent business judgment, to be confidential.
The Service Provider agrees to protect the proprietary information of the other with the same standard of care and procedures used by themselves to protect their own proprietary information of similar importance but at all times using at least a reasonable degree of care.
The provisions of this Clause shall survive the termination of this Agreement.
DATA PROTECTION, SECURITY, INTEGRITY, AND EXPORT OF DATA
The Service Provider undertakes that it shall comply with all applicable requirements of data protection rules, laws, notifications, and guidelines in force, including but not limited to the Information Technology Act, 2000 and all rules thereunder and all applicable notifications and orders issued by the RBI from time to time.
ICICI Bank shall be entitled to review and monitor the security practices and control processes of the Service Provider on a regular basis. The Service Provider shall immediately and in any case within  hours notify ICICI Bank of any breach or potential breach of security and leakage of any information including Confidential Information. The Service Provider shall be liable for all damages arising out of such breach of security.
The Service Provider shall, in relation to any of the ICICI Bank’s Confidential Information processed in connection with the performance by the Service Provider of its obligations under this Agreement:
maintain complete and accurate records and information to demonstrate its compliance with this Clause; 
[not transfer or export any of the ICICI Bank’s Confidential Information out of India;] 
notify ICICI Bank without undue delay on becoming aware of any breach of ICICI Bank’s Confidential Information;
ensure that it has in place appropriate technical and organisational measures, reviewed and approved by ICICI Bank, to protect against unauthorised or unlawful processing of the ICICI Bank’s Confidential Information and against accidental loss or destruction of, or damage to, ICICI Bank’s Confidential Information, appropriate to the harm that might result from the unauthorised or unlawful processing or accidental loss, destruction or damage and the nature of the data to be protected, having regard to the state of technological development and the cost of implementing any measures (those measures may include, where appropriate, pseudonymising and encrypting ICICI Bank’s Confidential Information, ensuring confidentiality, integrity, availability and resilience of its systems and services, ensuring that availability of and access to ICICI Bank’s Confidential Information can be restored in a timely manner after an incident, and regularly assessing and evaluating the effectiveness of the technical and organisational measures adopted by it).
ICICI Bank and/or the RBI shall be entitled to review and monitor the security practices and control processes of the Service Provider on a regular basis.
ensure that the details of the transfer of any Confidential Information are provided to ICICI Bank in the form and manner as set out in Annexure III to this Agreement.

No Partnership: Nothing in this Agreement is intended to, or shall be deemed to, establish any partnership or joint venture between any of the Parties, constitute any Party the agent of another Party, nor authorise any Party to make or enter into any commitments for or on behalf of any other Party, except as expressly authorised by ICICI Bank.
Survival: Any Clause that explicitly or implicitly may survive, shall survive the termination or expiry of this Agreement.
Amendment: Any provision of the Agreement may be amended or waived if, and only if such amendment or waiver is in writing and executed mutually by both Parties. In the event of any amendments required pursuant to or in relation to Applicable Laws, ICICI Bank is entitled to serve a notice in this regard to the Service Provider, and such amendment shall become effective on the date specified in such notice.
Remedies and Waiver: No failure to exercise, nor any delay in exercising, on the part of ICICI Bank, any right or remedy under the Agreement shall operate as a waiver, nor shall any single or partial exercise of any right or remedy prevent any further or other exercise or the exercise of any other right or remedy. The rights and remedies provided in the Agreement are cumulative and not exclusive of any rights or remedies provided by law.
Notice: All notices or other communications under or in connection with the Agreement shall be given in writing and, unless otherwise stated may be made by letter or facsimile. Any such notice or other communication will be deemed to be effective: 
if sent by letter, when delivered personally or if dispatched by post, when recall of the letter is outside the control of the sender; 
if sent by e-mail or any other electronic or telecommunication mode, when sent by the sender and 
(ii) 	if sent by facsimile, on receipt of a confirmation from the correct facsimile number.
Provided, however, that no notice or communication to ICICI Bank shall be effective unless actually received by ICICI Bank.  
The Service Provider acknowledges and confirms that notice, if any, provided by ICICI Bank, as specified in this section or in any other manner whatsoever, of any changes in rate(s) mentioned in the Agreement or any notice from ICICI Bank for payment of amounts at the changed rate(s), shall be treated by the Service Provider as sufficient and reasonable notice to the Service Provider and ICICI Bank is not bound to issue any further notice of such changes to the Service Provider.
Severance: The invalidity or unenforceability of any provisions or a part of a provision of the Agreement or any other Transaction Documents in any jurisdiction shall not affect the validity, legality or enforceability of the remainder of the Agreement or any other Transaction Documents in such jurisdiction or the validity, legality or enforceability of the Agreement or any other Transaction Documents, including any such provision, in any other jurisdiction, it being intended that all rights and obligations of the Parties under the Agreement or any other Transaction Documents shall be enforceable to the fullest extent permitted by Applicable Law.
Counterpart: If the Agreement or the other Transaction Documents are signed in counterparts, each counterpart shall be deemed to be an original.
Assignment: The Service Provider shall not assign or transfer all or any of its rights, benefits or obligations under the Agreement or any other Transaction Documents without the written approval of ICICI Bank. However, ICICI Bank may, at any time, assign or transfer all or any of its rights, benefits and obligations under the Agreement or any other Transaction Documents.
Entire Agreement: This Agreement along with the SOWs and Transaction Documents constitute the entire agreement between the Parties and supersedes any prior agreement, understanding, undertaking or arrangement between the Parties relating to the subject matter hereof.
Evidence: For all purposes, including any legal proceedings, a certificate by any of the ICICI Bank's officers as to the sums and liabilities for the time being due or incurred to ICICI Bank by the Service Provider under any of the Agreement shall, in the absence of manifest error, be final and conclusive evidence thereof against the Service Provider.
Agents: The Service Provider hereby agrees that the ICICI Bank may appoint, employ or authorise agents, sub-agents or associates (collectively, the "Agents") and delegate to any such Agents the performance of any of the ICICI Bank's duties and exercise of the ICICI Bank's rights hereunder.
Destruction of Documents: Subject to compliance with Applicable Laws, ICICI Bank may, at its discretion, destroy the documents relating to the Agreement or Services and ICICI Bank shall have no obligation to the Service Provider to retain any copies thereof and/or to return or to provide any copies thereof to the Service Provider.
