In these presents unless there is anything in the subject or context inconsistent therewith, the capitalised terms listed below shall have the following meanings:
“Affiliate” means with respect to a Party, any company, corporation, association or other entity, which, directly or indirectly, controls or is controlled by or is under common control with such Party.
“Agreement” shall mean this Agreement and any and all schedules to this Agreement or any future modifications or amendments made hereto in accordance with the terms and conditions of this Agreement.
"Applicable Law” shall mean any statute, regulation, notification, circular, order, ordinance, requirement, direction, guideline, announcement or other binding action or requirement of any Governmental Authority, which has the force of law in India (or any part thereof).
“Approval of the Loan” shall mean the electronic confirmation received from the Bank’s system pursuant to electronic confirmation issued by the Merchant as described in sub-section (iii) of the Conditions Precedent.
“Conditions Precedent” shall mean the following
Customer completing the Loan Process ;
Customer making the Down Payment (as defined hereinbelow);
The Merchant issuing an electronic confirmation to the Bank in regard to preceding provisions i.e. completion of Loan Process and the Down Payment made by Customer.
“Customer” means a Target Customer who intends to procure the Product(s) by applying for a Loan from the Bank. 
“Confidential Information” shall have the meaning assigned to such term in Schedule 6 hereto.
“Customer Information” shall have the meaning assigned to such term in Schedule 6 hereto.

“Disaster” shall mean an event defined as a disaster in the Disaster Recovery Plan.
“Disaster Recovery Plan” shall mean a plan which sets out the procedures to be adopted by Bank, and the Merchant in the event of a Disaster as set out in Schedule 7 hereto.

“Down Payment” shall mean the differential amount between the Product Price (as defined hereinbelow) and Loan.

“EMI” means the equal monthly installments payable by the Customer to the Bank in relation to the Loan (which consist of a portion of principal and interest on the Loan, payable monthly) in terms of the Terms & Conditions agreed by the Customer for the Loan, consisting of the principal and interest components.
“Governmental Authority” shall mean the government of India or government of any province or state or any other political subdivision thereof, any entity, authority or body exercising executive, legislative, judicial, quasi-judicial, regulatory or administrative functions of or pertaining to a government, including any government authority, agency, department, board, commission or instrumentality of India, any court, tribunal and any self-regulatory organisation;
“Employer Contribution” The amount contributed by the employer [who is the corporate customer of the Bank] of the Target Customer towards the purchase of the Products.

“Loan(s)” shall have the meaning assigned to such term in Recital D above.
“Loan Process” means the process, on Merchant Platform, of the Target Customer agreeing to and accepting by way of Online Acceptance, the Terms & Conditions applicable to the Loan including the Schedule cum Key Fact Statement and any other requirements as may be determined by the Bank, to the satisfaction of the Bank and which is more particularly described in the Schedule 4 annexed hereto.
“Loan Term” means the period within which Loan granted by the Bank to the Customer has been made by the Bank as repayable by the Customer. 
“Manufacturer” means the manufacturer of the Product.
“Merchant Platform” shall mean any web addresses, unique resource locators, applications, software, online platform (including without limitation mobile applications) of the Merchant (the contents of which are controlled and owned and managed by the Merchant and/or its Affiliates), which are used by the Merchant for the resale of Products online.

“Online Acceptance” shall mean the Target Customer having electronically accepted to the satisfaction of the Bank, on Merchant Platform and by way of one time password sent by the Bank’s notified service provider, all the Terms & Conditions applicable to the Loan, the schedule cum key fact statement thereto, Standing Instructions and all the contents thereof, in such manner and form as the Bank may require the Merchant to provide for on Merchant Platform.  
“Product” shall mean the specific consumer durable products or categories thereof available on the Merchant Platform for the purchase of which the Target Customers may avail the Loan and the list of which is set out in Schedule 4 hereto.  
“Product Price” means the current ongoing market price of the Product or such special price that the Merchant may offer for the Product on the Merchant Platform; however, inclusive of all applicable Taxes.

Services” shall collectively mean the services/ obligations the Merchant is required to perform under the terms of this Agreement.
“Service Levels” shall mean the minimum performance expectations in respect of the quality of the Services, the details of which are provided for in Schedule 2 hereto.
“Successful Purchase” means the purchase of selected Product by the Customer after Loan approval by the Bank and subsequent payment of Down Payment, successful delivery of the Product at the delivery address of the Customer and expiry of ___ days from delivery of the Product to the Customer such that such Product has not been returned or requested/ asked to be returned by the Customer within [●] days of delivery. 
“Target Customer” shall mean an employee of the Bank’s corporate customer who has a pre-approved credit limit by the Bank basis his credit profile and other criteria as determined by the Bank. 

“Taxes” means all taxes, cess, surcharge, duties, imposts, rates, any similar levies in any jurisdictions levied by/collected by/payable to any Governmental Authority (any or all of which, as may be applicable now or in future, and whether existing now or in future), interest, penalty and any other obligations in relation to any of the aforesaid including for any past liabilities and obligations, and shall without limitation include all direct and indirect taxes, all types of goods and services taxes, toll taxes, municipal, local, road transport taxes, etc.
“Term” shall have the meaning assigned to such term in Clause 9.1 below.
“Terms & Conditions” means the terms and conditions of the Bank accepted by way of Online Acceptance by the Customer for the Loan.
PURCHASE OF PRODUCT(S) BY THE TARGET CUSTOMER BY AVAILING LOAN 
As part of the online purchase/ booking of the Product(s), by the Target Customer through the Merchant Platform, the Merchant shall obtain before following steps, the express consent of the Target Customers authorizing the Merchant to share the Customer Information with the Bank either directly or through any service provider(s) of the Merchant . 
The Merchant agrees and undertakes to adhere to the following process and to perform its obligations as under: 
On the Target Customer approaching the Merchant to avail a Loan for purchase of the Product, the Merchant shall check the eligibility of the Target Customer to avail a Loan in accordance with Schedule 3 hereto. Upon the confirmation from the Merchant in regard to eligibility, the Target Customer will complete the Loan Process and shall pay the Down Payment  through the payment gateway. 
Upon receiving the Down Payment, the Merchant shall confirm the order and provide an electronic confirmation of Down Payment to the Bank and if so required by the Bank, the Merchant will furnish necessary proof/ suitable evidence in this regard. 
After the Bank decides to sanction a Loan to a Target Customer (which decision the Bank will make, in its sole discretion, subject to the Customer fulfilling the eligibility criteria and after completing such checks and receipt of such information, applications and/ or documents from the Target Customer as the Bank deems fit), and after completion of all Conditions Precedent and the Approval of Loan,  the Bank may disburse the Loan (subject to the Terms & Conditions applicable to the Loan as accepted by the Target Customer), directly to the account specified by the Merchant. It is clarified that, where the Loan is disbursed by the Bank in the aforementioned mode, such disbursement shall be deemed to be a disbursement by the Bank to the  Customer and the full amount thereof shall be deemed to have been paid by the Bank to the Merchant on behalf of the Customer towards purchase of the Product.
The Loan can be offered on the Products on the Merchant Platform subject to the credit limit as the Bank may decide for each Target Customer. 
The Merchant shall assist the Bank in the collection of any information and such requisite documents online from the Target Customer for availing the Loan, as may be required by the Bank. The Merchant may change the look, feel, design sequencing, contents on the Merchant Platform as may be mutually agreed between the Parties from time to time. 
Notwithstanding anything to the contrary herein or any other documents, the Bank may at its absolute and sole discretion grant or refuse to grant the Loan and it shall not at any point of time be required to give any reason or explanation for such refusal to the Merchant or any Customer and regardless of whether the Customer fulfils the eligibility criteria.
Upon the disbursement of the Loan into the Merchant’s account, the Merchant shall be responsible for the delivery of the Product to the Customer and shall provide confirmation to the Bank of due delivery of the Product to the Customer and if so required by the Bank, the Merchant will furnish necessary proof in this regard.
Return of Product by Customer and cancellation of Loan:
In case where a Customer initiates a return of the Product to the Merchant and the Merchant accepts the return in accordance with the Product’s return policies within a week, such an action shall amount to cancellation of the Loan by the Bank to the Customer.
As more particularly described in Schedule 3 hereto, the Merchant will share the list of Customers whose return of the Product has been accepted by the Merchant with the Bank as and when required through the cancellation API.
While disbursing the Loan amount(s) as mentioned under Clause 2.2 hereto, the Bank shall have the right to deduct/ set-off the amounts pertaining to cancelled Loans amounts., the Bank shall disburse only the difference in the Loan amounts of the Customers whose Loan the Bank has boarded and the cancelled Loan amounts. The balance amount of the Loan for the Product shall therefore be paid by the Merchant to the Manufacturer, as if disbursed by the Bank. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary, the Bank shall be deemed to have disbursed the complete Loan amount(s) to the Merchant as if no set off was done by it.
For each Loan granted by the Bank,  an  email will be sent by the Merchant from [ noreply@softcell.com]  to the Bank with the name of the Customer, date of purchase of Product, Product details, Product Price, Loan amount disbursed by the Bank, Terms & Conditions accepted by the Customer by way of Online Acceptance on the Merchant Platform and such other details and in such form and manner as the Bank may require. For this purpose, the Bank shall specify an email address from time to time. The Merchant shall also copy the Customer to whom such a Loan is being granted on every such email being sent to the Bank. The Merchant shall use the corporate email address of the Customer, as registered with the Bank for these purposes.

that the computer output containing the information under this Agreement was produced by the computer during the period over which the computer was used regularly to store or process information for the purposes of any activities regularly carried on over that period by the person having lawful control over the use of the computer;
during the said period, information of the kind contained in the electronic record or of the kind from which the information so contained is derived was regularly fed into the computer in the ordinary course of the said activities;

DISBURSAL PROCESS.
The Merchant agrees and acknowledges that it shall not have any lien, charge, encumbrance or any similar right over any payment made/ amount received by the Customer. As more particularly described in Schedule 3 hereto, the Merchant will share the list of Customers whose Loans were approved by the Bank on a particular day. This will be done on a daily basis by the Merchant. The Bank shall disburse the Loan availed by the Customers to the Merchant’s account within a period of two(2) working days from the Approval of the Loans after netting off fees/charges, if any. (“Disbursal Process”) 
Neither the Merchant nor the Customer shall have any right of lien, set-off or counterclaim or withholding or deduction including any deduction of or withholding for or on account of any Tax of any nature or any similar right having hereby been irrevocably waived.
In consideration of fulfilment and performance of the obligations under this Agreement, such Fee as may be stipulated in the Fee Letter, which shall be separately agreed upon and signed by the Parties, shall be payable by the relevant Party as mentioned in the Fee Letter. If so required by the Bank, the Merchant shall provide to the Bank Goods and Services Tax related registration numbers including Goods and Services Tax Identification Number ("GSTIN"), any proof or documents the Bank may require in this regard and all such details, information, documents, papers as the Bank may require in this regard, to enable the Bank to claim input credits as and when required by the Bank. The Bank shall be entitled to rely on any such information or details without verifying the correctness of the same. Any payment of Fee by the Bank to the Merchant, if applicable, shall be full discharge of the Bank’s obligations and the Merchant shall not have any claim against the Bank for such portion of the Fee which is so paid from time to time.The Fees shall be exclusive of all goods and services tax (including, without limitation, CGST, SGST, UTGST, IGST, J&KGST) and applicable cess/ surcharge. In case any input tax credit, refund or other benefit is denied or delayed due to any breach, delay or non-compliance by the Merchant (including, without limitation, as a result of failure to upload the details of the sale on the goods and service tax network (GSTN) portal, failure to pay goods and services tax to the relevant Governmental Authority or due to non-furnishing or furnishing of incorrect or incomplete documents by the Merchant), the Merchant shall reimburse to the Bank, the loss suffered by the Bank including, but not limited to, the tax loss, interest and penalty. The above-mentioned penalty will be subject to the levy of applicable goods and services tax and cess/ surcharge.
The Parties shall be entitled to deduct tax at source on payments made hereunder in accordance with the Applicable Law. Where the Bank is entitled to deduct tax at source on payments, the Merchant shall be responsible to report any non-receipt of certificate of taxes deducted at source within 90 (Ninety) days of deduction of such taxes at source by the Bank.
The Merchant shall extend all the required co-operation in the defense of any claim/s by any Governmental Authority against the Bank with respect to any taxes and/ or duties due and payable by, or under the authority of the Merchant.

This Agreement shall come into force from the Effective Date and shall be in force and effect for the period of 3 (Three) years (“Term”), unless terminated earlier in accordance with the provisions of this Agreement. After completion of the Term, this Agreement may be renewed for a further periods of 3 (Three) year(s) by the Parties, upon such mutually agreed terms and conditions, as the Parties may agree, in writing. 
Either Party shall have the right to terminate this Agreement without assigning a reason by issuing 60 (sixty) days prior written notice to the other Party to that effect. 
Either Party shall be entitled to forthwith terminate this Agreement in the event that:
the other Party is in default of any of its material obligations hereunder and such default is not remedied within sixty (60) days from receipt of written notice thereof from the non-defaulting Party, 
the other Party is adjudicated bankrupt or becomes insolvent, makes any assignment for the benefit of creditors, proceedings are instituted by the such Party seeking relief, reorganization or rearrangement under any laws relating to insolvency, bankruptcy or similar laws of any jurisdiction, a receiver, liquidator or trustee is appointed in respect of any property or assets of the other Party or an order is made for the liquidation, dissolution or winding up of the other Party. 
Notwithstanding the foregoing, the Bank shall be entitled to forthwith terminate this Agreement in the event a regulatory order is passed, which prejudicially affects the Bank’s ability to continue with the collaboration envisaged herein;
Upon termination of this Agreement for any reasons whatsoever or expiry of this Agreement, as the case may be :
The Merchant shall forthwith hand over to the Bank the possession of all documents, material and any other property belonging to the Bank and the customers or pertaining to the Loan that may be in the possession of the Merchant;
The Merchant will cease to sell, promote, market or advertise the Loan and shall remove all signs and boards in connection with the Loan from its premises; and
Each Party shall refrain from any action that would or may indicate any relationship between it;
Each Party will immediately cease to use in any manner whatsoever the trademarks, name, and logos of the other Party.
Consequences of expiry or termination of this Agreement 
In the event of termination by either Party as per clause 9.2 mentioned hereinabove, the rights and obligations of the Parties under this Agreement shall continue in full force and effect during the notice period (i.e. a period of 180 days) till the applicable date of termination of the Agreement.
The expiry or the termination of this Agreement shall not affect:
The obligations of the Parties under Clauses 3.2, 3.3, 3.4, 3.5, 3.6 , 6.7, 8, 10 , 11 and Clause II of Schedule 6 of this Agreement.

The terms of this Agreement may be amended mutually by Parties, save to the extent of regulatory requirements, in writing.
No Partnership: Nothing contained in the Agreement shall constitute or be deemed to constitute a partnership between the Parties, and no Party shall hold itself out as an agent for the other Party, except with the express prior written consent of the other Party or except as expressly mentioned in this Agreement. In particular the Merchant shall not be entitled to use the name or logo of the Bank in connection with the business carried out by it, except as may be expressly permitted by the Bank in writing.
Waiver: Waiver of any breach of any provision of this Agreement shall not constitute a waiver of any prior, concurrent or subsequent breach of the same or any other provisions hereof, and no waiver shall be effective, unless made in writing and signed by an authorised representative of the waiving Party.
Severability: If any provision of this Agreement is invalid, unenforceable or prohibited by law, this Agreement shall be considered divisible as to such provision and such provision shall be inoperative and shall not be part of the consideration moving from either Party hereto to the other, and the remainder of this Agreement shall continue to remain valid, binding as though such provision was not included herein. In such an event, the Parties shall make all possible efforts to replace the invalid/ unenforceable/ illegal provision with a valid, enforceable and legal provision embodying the intention of the Parties as gathered from the earlier provision.
Amendments :
No amendments to this Agreement and/or schedules  attached hereto shall be valid, unless the same are reduced to writing and signed by the duly authorized representatives of the Parties.
Anti-Corruption
In relation to this Agreement, the Parties shall not make any payment to induce officials to perform routine functions they are otherwise obligated to perform, also known as “facilitating payments.” Furthermore, in relation to this Agreement, the Parties shall refrain from making any payment to any person in a manner which would constitute or have the purpose of public or commercial bribery, or the acceptance of or acquiescence in extortion, kickbacks, or other unlawful or improper means of obtaining business or any improper advantage. Breach of these obligations by either Party will entitle the non-breaching party to terminate this Agreement immediately.
Expenses & Taxes
Except as otherwise expressly provided in this Agreement, all Taxes, rates, duties, (including stamp duties) charges and other imposts and obligations, existing as well as future on and/or in connection with this Agreement shall be  borne and be payable by the Parties equally .
In case either Party ends up incurring  costs, expenses, Taxes, etc. due to the default of the other Party, the defaulting Party shall reimburse or pay to the non-defaulting Party all such amounts as may have been paid by the non-defaulting Party to the Governmental Authority or any other authority or any department, on account of any Tax, cess, surcharge, levied (and/or other charges) by the Governmental Authority or any other authority or department within a period of 10 days from the receipt of notice by the non-defaulting Party. In addition to the same, the non-defaulting Party shall also have a right to deduct/set-off the costs, expenses , taxes incurred from the amounts owed by the defaulting Party to it.
Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery Plans
The Merchant agrees and undertakes that it has/ shall develop and maintain a robust framework for (i) documenting, maintaining and testing business ‘continuity and recovery procedures’ in relation to the Services, and (ii) development of a comprehensive fool-proof system for warehousing safe custody and retrieval of all records, data, documents and other information material to the Services.
The Merchant shall periodically test all such business continuity and recovery plans so as to maintain efficacy and efficiency of such plans. The Bank shall also be entitled to test or cause to be tested the business continuity and recovery plans which are implemented by the Merchant at such intervals as the Bank may, in its sole discretion, deem fit and the Bank shall also have the right to require joint testing and carry our recovery exercises, by the Merchant and the Bank.
The Merchant shall comply at all times with the relevant provisions of the Disaster Recovery Plan. Following the declaration of a Disaster in respect of any of the Services, the Merchant shall:
implement the Disaster Recovery Plan;
continue to provide the affected Services in accordance with the Disaster Recovery Plan; and
restore the affected Services to normal within the period laid out in the Disaster Recovery Plan.
Sub-contractors
The Bank shall have the right to engage any service provider/ sub-contractor/ agent for any activity or part of the activity at the Bank’s discretion, including for verification/ authentication of the Customers. The Bank may change such service provider/ sub-contractor/ agent at any time from time to time without giving any notice or intimation to the Merchant. Provided that the Bank shall intimate the Merchant regarding such a change after such change taking place. 
The Merchant may, after providing intimation to the Bank at least 15 (Fifteen) days in advance, and at no cost to the Bank, contract with a third-party subcontractor to perform all or any of its obligations under this Agreement. For the avoidance of doubt, it is clarified that the sub-contractors shall not be released from any responsibility hereunder as a result of the use of any subcontractor and the Merchant shall remain exclusively and fully responsible and liable towards the Bank for the due performance of its obligations by any subcontractor. 
Counterparts 
This Agreement may be executed in one or more counterparts, each of which will constitute an original and all of which taken together will constitute one and the same Agreement.  .
Entire Agreement
This Agreement, including all Schedules, contains the complete understanding and agreement of the Parties and supersedes all prior or contemporaneous agreements or understandings, oral or written, relating to the subject matter herein.

The Merchant agrees and undertakes during the term of this Agreement and for 3 (Three) years after its termination for any reason (except in case of obligations towards Customer Information which shall not be limited to expiry of said 3 (Three) years), to regard and preserve as confidential, all Confidential Information of the other Party which may be obtained from any source as a result of this Agreement. In maintaining confidentiality hereunder, the Merchant agrees that it shall not disclose or make available to any third party, person, firm or enterprise, reproduce or transmit, or use (directly or indirectly) for its own benefit or the benefit of others, any Confidential Information of the Bank. "Confidential Information" means:
Customer Information, any documents, data, or information that is not generally known to the public, including but not limited to, operations, customer relationships, customer profiles or other customer information relating to the past, present or future business activities of a Party, its parent corporations, subsidiaries and affiliates and the customers, clients and suppliers of any of the foregoing;
any scientific or technical information, design, process, procedure, formula or improvement that is commercially valuable and not publicly available;
all confidential or proprietary concepts, documentation, reports, lists, files, data, specifications, software, systems, source code, object code, flow charts, databases, data files, inventions, information, know-how and trade secrets, whether or not patentable or copyrightable.
If the Merchant violates or causes to be violated any of the provisions of this Clause II (Confidentiality) the Bank shall, without prejudice to its other rights to claim injunctive relief, be entitled to claim from the Party at fault, and the Party at fault shall be liable to pay to the Bank, compensation to the tune of actual amount of damages as determined and supported by proof of evidence, by the Bank.
The Merchant shall, upon the request of the Bank, immediately destroy all Confidential Information of the Bank in its possession or control, by shredding or incineration of all documents and other material, which is in a physical form or irretrievably delete such Confidential Information recorded or stored by electronic means or otherwise, including all copies thereof and evidence of such destruction shall be provided to Bank to its reasonable satisfaction.
The Merchant confirms that it shall, upon the request of the Bank, immediately return all Confidential Information of the Bank in its possession or control, which is in a physical form or recorded or stored by electronic means or otherwise, including all copies thereof.
This Clause II (Confidentiality) shall survive expiry or termination of this Agreement.

Statement of Work (SOW) for CASB Tool
Problem Statement:
Visibility and Control: Gaining comprehensive visibility Endpoint and enforcing security policies consistently across Network and third party Applications.
Threat Detection and Response: Detecting and responding to endpoint-specific security threats, including insider threats, malware, Ransomwaresand account compromises.
Compliance Adherence: XDR will aid in meeting compliance requirements by providing centralized visibility and enabling efficient reporting and audit trails.
Resource Consumption: Antivirus scans can be resource-intensive, impacting system performance during scans, updates, and real-time protection, sometimes leading to slowdowns or compatibility issues with other software.
Prevention Against Zero-day attacks: Identifying and mitigating threats for which there are no known signatures or patterns, thereby requiring advanced heuristics and behaviour-based analysis.
Business Objective:
The primary business objective of implementing a Extended Detection and Response (XDR) solution to enhance Endpoint security. XDR solution will provide a more comprehensive view of our endpoint security posture by collecting data from multiple sources, such as endpoints, network devices, and cloud services, and then using that data to detect and respond to threats.
Certainly, here are some key business objectives associated with implementing a XDR:
Meeting Client RFP’s: Client RFPs increasingly emphasize the need for a unified security solution capable of providing end-to-end threat visibility and response capabilities across diverse platforms. This necessitates the implementation of an Extended Detection and Response (XDR) system to fulfil these requirements.
Holistic Threat Detection: Traditional security tools often operate in silos, which hinders the ability to detect and respond to sophisticated, multi-vector cyber threats effectively. XDR addresses this by aggregating and correlating data from various security layers, offering a more comprehensive view of potential threats across an organization’s entire IT environment.
Efficient Incident Response: There’s a growing need for faster and more efficient incident response capabilities. XDR provides a unified platform that streamlines the detection, investigation, and response to security incidents, reducing the mean time to detect and respond (MTTD/MTTR) significantly. 
Regulatory Compliance and Risk Mitigation: With the capability to aggregate, analyze, and report security data, XDR supports businesses in meeting compliance standards across different regulatory frameworks. By offering a centralized view and aiding in audit trails and reporting, XDR contributes to minimizing risks associated with non-compliance. This use case ensures that businesses maintain a robust security posture while meeting regulatory requirements, reducing the possibility of fines and reputational damage due to non-compliance.
Current Use Case
Project Overview
This Statement of Work (SOW) outlines the scope of work and deliverables for the implementation of XDR tool at Sirion Labs. The objective of this project is to enhance the security of our endpoints (Laptop/Desktops) ensuring data protection, threat detection, and compliance with regulatory requirements.
Project Scope
No. of Users - 1100
Assessment and Planning:
Reviewing the existing security infrastructure, identifying gaps, and designing an implementation plan.
Installation and Configuration: (We will install the CS sensor on 20 windows machines, 5 Mac and 5 Linux machines, Rest customer will have to deploy using third party tool or GPO. Softcell team will help in troubleshooting if required.)
Deploying the XDR solution and configuring it to integrate with existing security systems and networks.
Customization and Integration: 
Tailoring the solution to fit the specific needs of the organization, which may involve custom rule sets, policies, and integration with SIEM, SOAR, or other security tools.
Testing and Validation: (We will test policies on 20 windows machines, 5 Mac and 5 Linux machines, Rest customer will have to deploy using third party tool or GPO)
Thoroughly testing the XDR solution to ensure it detects, alerts, and responds effectively to security threats.
Ongoing Support and Maintenance: (It is already added from Crowd strike. Customer will have to procure 1 year support services (12 incident Pack) from Softcell if he need softcell support)
Offering post-implementation support, updates, and maintenance to ensure the continued effectiveness of the XDR solution.
Reporting and Monitoring: 
Setting up reporting mechanisms and monitoring tools to track the performance and efficacy of the XDR solution.

Any invalid or unenforceable provision of this Agreement shall be replaced with a provision, which is valid and enforceable and most nearly reflects the original intent of the invalid and unenforceable provision.

Force Majeure: Notwithstanding anything contained in this Agreement, in the event of this Agreement or any part thereof being rendered wholly or partially impossible of performance by either Party for any reason beyond its reasonable control, including but not limited to outbreak of any pandemic and/or epidemic (except for the Covid-19 pandemic), fire, flood, casualty, lockout, strike, labour disputes, industrial action of any kind, unavoidable accident, or, national calamity or riot, Act of God, the enactment of any Act of Parliament or the act of any other legally constituted authority, or any cause or event arising out of or attributable to war, or any other similar cause or event outside the control of the Parties hereto, then such non-performance shall not be deemed to constitute a breach of this Agreement therein and shall not be liable to pay any damages. The Party affected by Force Majeure shall take steps as are reasonably necessary to remove the causes resulting in force majeure if within its control and to mitigate the effect thereof. 
Survival: The provisions of this Agreement, which by their nature are intended to survive the termination or expiration of this Agreement, including without limitation, Clause 8 (Indemnification and Limitation of Liability), Clause 9 (Confidentiality) and Clause 10 (Intellectual Property Rights and Ownership).
Counterparts: This Agreement may be executed in one or more counterparts, each of which when so executed and delivered shall be deemed an original but all of which together shall constitute one and the same instrument and any Party may execute this Agreement by signing any one or more of such originals or counterparts. Cost and Expenses: Each of the Parties hereto shall pay their respective costs and expenses relating to this Agreement unless otherwise provided herein.
Amendments: This Agreement may not be amended, modified or supplemented except by a written instrument mutually agreed between and executed by each of the Parties. 
Non-Exclusivity: Nothing in this Agreement will restrict either Party’s right to enter into similar or identical arrangements as contemplated in this Agreement with any third party.

The Parties hereby undertake and agree to maintain the confidentiality of the Confidential Information and undertake not to disclose such Confidential Information to any third party except with the prior written consent of the other Party, unless such disclosure is required under law or upon receiving an order of a governmental, judicial or regulatory authority. The Parties further undertake to take the same steps to maintain the confidentiality of the Confidential Information as it would to protect its own confidential information.
Each Party agrees to hold secret and protect the other Party's Confidential Information and use that degree of care that it uses or would use with respect to its own proprietary and confidential information to keep the Confidential Information secret.
Notwithstanding the foregoing, either Party may disclose Confidential Information of the other Party which is: (i) already publicly known, (ii) discovered or created by the receiving Party without reference to the Confidential Information of the disclosing Party, as shown in records of receiving Party, (iii) otherwise known to the receiving Party through no wrongful conduct of the receiving Party, (iv) required to be disclosed by law or court order, provided that Party to whom such order is issued provides the other Party reasonable advance notice of its intended disclosure. Each Party hereby acknowledges that disclosure of the Confidential Information by it or breach of the provisions contained herein may give rise to irreparable injury to the other Party and such breach or disclosure may be inadequately compensable in money damages. Accordingly, each Party may seek injunctive relief against the breach or threatened breach of the foregoing undertakings.
Neither Party shall disclose the terms of this Agreement to any third party other than its affiliates and their legal counsel and accountants without the other Party's prior written consent.
The confidentiality obligations in respect of each such Confidential Information shall survive for a period of two years from the date of expiry / termination of the Agreement, except if required under Applicable Law for a longer period.

Service Levels are priority levels assigned to any issues including but not limited to interruptions, delays, and errors affecting the functionality of the Software (collectively, "Errors") based on urgency, number of users affected, type and extent of service disrupted and availability of a workaround or fall-back. When an Error is communicated to the Service Provider, ICICI Bank shall assign the severity level of the Error based on the severity definitions listed below. notify ICICI Bank immediately of such failure;
deploy all additional resources and take all remedial action that is necessary to rectify or to prevent the failure of the Service Level from recurring.
within 3 (three) business days or any other timeline more particularly identified in the SOW, the Service Provider will be required to perform and provide to ICICI Bank a root-cause analysis for any incident that would contribute to the Service Provider missing a service level.
If there is a failure of Service Levels, the Service Provider shall pay or credit to the Service Provider service level credits in accordance with the relevant SOW in recognition of the diminished value of the Services resulting from the Service Provider’s failure to meet the agreed upon level of performance.

ensure that it has in place appropriate technical and organisational measures, reviewed and approved by ICICI Bank, to protect against unauthorised or unlawful processing of the ICICI Bank’s Confidential Information and against accidental loss or destruction of, or damage to, ICICI Bank’s Confidential Information, appropriate to the harm that might result from the unauthorised or unlawful processing or accidental loss, destruction or damage and the nature of the data to be protected, having regard to the state of technological development and the cost of implementing any measures (those measures may include, where appropriate, pseudonymising and encrypting ICICI Bank’s Confidential Information, ensuring confidentiality, integrity, availability and resilience of its systems and services, ensuring that availability of and access to ICICI Bank’s Confidential Information can be restored in a timely manner after an incident, and regularly assessing and evaluating the effectiveness of the technical and organisational measures adopted by it).

ensure that the details of the transfer of any Confidential Information are provided to ICICI Bank in the form and manner as set out in Annexure III to this Agreement.

No Partnership: Nothing in this Agreement is intended to, or shall be deemed to, establish any partnership or joint venture between any of the Parties, constitute any Party the agent of another Party, nor authorise any Party to make or enter into any commitments for or on behalf of any other Party, except as expressly authorised by ICICI Bank.
Survival: Any Clause that explicitly or implicitly may survive, shall survive the termination or expiry of this Agreement.
Amendment: Any provision of the Agreement may be amended or waived if, and only if such amendment or waiver is in writing and executed mutually by both Parties. In the event of any amendments required pursuant to or in relation to Applicable Laws, ICICI Bank is entitled to serve a notice in this regard to the Service Provider, and such amendment shall become effective on the date specified in such notice.
Remedies and Waiver: No failure to exercise, nor any delay in exercising, on the part of ICICI Bank, any right or remedy under the Agreement shall operate as a waiver, nor shall any single or partial exercise of any right or remedy prevent any further or other exercise or the exercise of any other right or remedy. The rights and remedies provided in the Agreement are cumulative and not exclusive of any rights or remedies provided by law.
Notice: All notices or other communications under or in connection with the Agreement shall be given in writing and, unless otherwise stated may be made by letter or facsimile. Any such notice or other communication will be deemed to be effective: 
if sent by letter, when delivered personally or if dispatched by post, when recall of the letter is outside the control of the sender; 
if sent by e-mail or any other electronic or telecommunication mode, when sent by the sender and 
(ii) 	if sent by facsimile, on receipt of a confirmation from the correct facsimile number.
Provided, however, that no notice or communication to ICICI Bank shall be effective unless actually received by ICICI Bank.  
The Service Provider acknowledges and confirms that notice, if any, provided by ICICI Bank, as specified in this section or in any other manner whatsoever, of any changes in rate(s) mentioned in the Agreement or any notice from ICICI Bank for payment of amounts at the changed rate(s), shall be treated by the Service Provider as sufficient and reasonable notice to the Service Provider and ICICI Bank is not bound to issue any further notice of such changes to the Service Provider.
Severance: The invalidity or unenforceability of any provisions or a part of a provision of the Agreement or any other Transaction Documents in any jurisdiction shall not affect the validity, legality or enforceability of the remainder of the Agreement or any other Transaction Documents in such jurisdiction or the validity, legality or enforceability of the Agreement or any other Transaction Documents, including any such provision, in any other jurisdiction, it being intended that all rights and obligations of the Parties under the Agreement or any other Transaction Documents shall be enforceable to the fullest extent permitted by Applicable Law.
Counterpart: If the Agreement or the other Transaction Documents are signed in counterparts, each counterpart shall be deemed to be an original.
Assignment: The Service Provider shall not assign or transfer all or any of its rights, benefits or obligations under the Agreement or any other Transaction Documents without the written approval of ICICI Bank. However, ICICI Bank may, at any time, assign or transfer all or any of its rights, benefits and obligations under the Agreement or any other Transaction Documents.
Entire Agreement: This Agreement along with the SOWs and Transaction Documents constitute the entire agreement between the Parties and supersedes any prior agreement, understanding, undertaking or arrangement between the Parties relating to the subject matter hereof.
Evidence: For all purposes, including any legal proceedings, a certificate by any of the ICICI Bank's officers as to the sums and liabilities for the time being due or incurred to ICICI Bank by the Service Provider under any of the Agreement shall, in the absence of manifest error, be final and conclusive evidence thereof against the Service Provider.
Agents: The Service Provider hereby agrees that the ICICI Bank may appoint, employ or authorise agents, sub-agents or associates (collectively, the "Agents") and delegate to any such Agents the performance of any of the ICICI Bank's duties and exercise of the ICICI Bank's rights hereunder.
Destruction of Documents: Subject to compliance with Applicable Laws, ICICI Bank may, at its discretion, destroy the documents relating to the Agreement or Services and ICICI Bank shall have no obligation to the Service Provider to retain any copies thereof and/or to return or to provide any copies thereof to the Service Provider.

In these presents unless there is anything in the subject or context inconsistent therewith, the capitalised terms listed below shall have the following meanings:
“Affiliate” means with respect to a Party, any company, corporation, association or other entity, which, directly or indirectly, controls or is controlled by or is under common control with such Party.
“Agreement” shall mean this Agreement and any and all schedules to this Agreement or any future modifications or amendments made hereto in accordance with the terms and conditions of this Agreement.
"Applicable Law” shall mean any statute, regulation, notification, circular, order, ordinance, requirement, direction, guideline, announcement or other binding action or requirement of any Governmental Authority, which has the force of law in India (or any part thereof).
“Approval of the Loan” shall mean the electronic confirmation received from the Bank’s system pursuant to electronic confirmation issued by the Merchant as described in sub-section (iii) of the Conditions Precedent.
“Conditions Precedent” shall mean the following
Customer completing the Loan Process ;
Customer making the Down Payment (as defined hereinbelow);
The Merchant issuing an electronic confirmation to the Bank in regard to preceding provisions i.e. completion of Loan Process and the Down Payment made by Customer.
“Customer” means a Target Customer who intends to procure the Product(s) by applying for a Loan from the Bank. 
“Confidential Information” shall have the meaning assigned to such term in Schedule 6 hereto.
“Customer Information” shall have the meaning assigned to such term in Schedule 6 hereto.

“Disaster” shall mean an event defined as a disaster in the Disaster Recovery Plan.
“Disaster Recovery Plan” shall mean a plan which sets out the procedures to be adopted by Bank, and the Merchant in the event of a Disaster as set out in Schedule 7 hereto.

“Down Payment” shall mean the differential amount between the Product Price (as defined hereinbelow) and Loan.

“EMI” means the equal monthly installments payable by the Customer to the Bank in relation to the Loan (which consist of a portion of principal and interest on the Loan, payable monthly) in terms of the Terms & Conditions agreed by the Customer for the Loan, consisting of the principal and interest components.
“Governmental Authority” shall mean the government of India or government of any province or state or any other political subdivision thereof, any entity, authority or body exercising executive, legislative, judicial, quasi-judicial, regulatory or administrative functions of or pertaining to a government, including any government authority, agency, department, board, commission or instrumentality of India, any court, tribunal and any self-regulatory organisation;
“Employer Contribution” The amount contributed by the employer [who is the corporate customer of the Bank] of the Target Customer towards the purchase of the Products.

“Loan(s)” shall have the meaning assigned to such term in Recital D above.
“Loan Process” means the process, on Merchant Platform, of the Target Customer agreeing to and accepting by way of Online Acceptance, the Terms & Conditions applicable to the Loan including the Schedule cum Key Fact Statement and any other requirements as may be determined by the Bank, to the satisfaction of the Bank and which is more particularly described in the Schedule 4 annexed hereto.
“Loan Term” means the period within which Loan granted by the Bank to the Customer has been made by the Bank as repayable by the Customer. 
“Manufacturer” means the manufacturer of the Product.
“Merchant Platform” shall mean any web addresses, unique resource locators, applications, software, online platform (including without limitation mobile applications) of the Merchant (the contents of which are controlled and owned and managed by the Merchant and/or its Affiliates), which are used by the Merchant for the resale of Products online.

“Online Acceptance” shall mean the Target Customer having electronically accepted to the satisfaction of the Bank, on Merchant Platform and by way of one time password sent by the Bank’s notified service provider, all the Terms & Conditions applicable to the Loan, the schedule cum key fact statement thereto, Standing Instructions and all the contents thereof, in such manner and form as the Bank may require the Merchant to provide for on Merchant Platform.  
“Product” shall mean the specific consumer durable products or categories thereof available on the Merchant Platform for the purchase of which the Target Customers may avail the Loan and the list of which is set out in Schedule 4 hereto.  
“Product Price” means the current ongoing market price of the Product or such special price that the Merchant may offer for the Product on the Merchant Platform; however, inclusive of all applicable Taxes.

Services” shall collectively mean the services/ obligations the Merchant is required to perform under the terms of this Agreement.
“Service Levels” shall mean the minimum performance expectations in respect of the quality of the Services, the details of which are provided for in Schedule 2 hereto.
“Successful Purchase” means the purchase of selected Product by the Customer after Loan approval by the Bank and subsequent payment of Down Payment, successful delivery of the Product at the delivery address of the Customer and expiry of ___ days from delivery of the Product to the Customer such that such Product has not been returned or requested/ asked to be returned by the Customer within [●] days of delivery. 
“Target Customer” shall mean an employee of the Bank’s corporate customer who has a pre-approved credit limit by the Bank basis his credit profile and other criteria as determined by the Bank. 

“Taxes” means all taxes, cess, surcharge, duties, imposts, rates, any similar levies in any jurisdictions levied by/collected by/payable to any Governmental Authority (any or all of which, as may be applicable now or in future, and whether existing now or in future), interest, penalty and any other obligations in relation to any of the aforesaid including for any past liabilities and obligations, and shall without limitation include all direct and indirect taxes, all types of goods and services taxes, toll taxes, municipal, local, road transport taxes, etc.
“Term” shall have the meaning assigned to such term in Clause 9.1 below.
“Terms & Conditions” means the terms and conditions of the Bank accepted by way of Online Acceptance by the Customer for the Loan.
PURCHASE OF PRODUCT(S) BY THE TARGET CUSTOMER BY AVAILING LOAN 
As part of the online purchase/ booking of the Product(s), by the Target Customer through the Merchant Platform, the Merchant shall obtain before following steps, the express consent of the Target Customers authorizing the Merchant to share the Customer Information with the Bank either directly or through any service provider(s) of the Merchant . 
The Merchant agrees and undertakes to adhere to the following process and to perform its obligations as under: 
On the Target Customer approaching the Merchant to avail a Loan for purchase of the Product, the Merchant shall check the eligibility of the Target Customer to avail a Loan in accordance with Schedule 3 hereto. Upon the confirmation from the Merchant in regard to eligibility, the Target Customer will complete the Loan Process and shall pay the Down Payment  through the payment gateway. 
Upon receiving the Down Payment, the Merchant shall confirm the order and provide an electronic confirmation of Down Payment to the Bank and if so required by the Bank, the Merchant will furnish necessary proof/ suitable evidence in this regard. 
After the Bank decides to sanction a Loan to a Target Customer (which decision the Bank will make, in its sole discretion, subject to the Customer fulfilling the eligibility criteria and after completing such checks and receipt of such information, applications and/ or documents from the Target Customer as the Bank deems fit), and after completion of all Conditions Precedent and the Approval of Loan,  the Bank may disburse the Loan (subject to the Terms & Conditions applicable to the Loan as accepted by the Target Customer), directly to the account specified by the Merchant. It is clarified that, where the Loan is disbursed by the Bank in the aforementioned mode, such disbursement shall be deemed to be a disbursement by the Bank to the  Customer and the full amount thereof shall be deemed to have been paid by the Bank to the Merchant on behalf of the Customer towards purchase of the Product.
The Loan can be offered on the Products on the Merchant Platform subject to the credit limit as the Bank may decide for each Target Customer. 
The Merchant shall assist the Bank in the collection of any information and such requisite documents online from the Target Customer for availing the Loan, as may be required by the Bank. The Merchant may change the look, feel, design sequencing, contents on the Merchant Platform as may be mutually agreed between the Parties from time to time. 
Notwithstanding anything to the contrary herein or any other documents, the Bank may at its absolute and sole discretion grant or refuse to grant the Loan and it shall not at any point of time be required to give any reason or explanation for such refusal to the Merchant or any Customer and regardless of whether the Customer fulfils the eligibility criteria.
Upon the disbursement of the Loan into the Merchant’s account, the Merchant shall be responsible for the delivery of the Product to the Customer and shall provide confirmation to the Bank of due delivery of the Product to the Customer and if so required by the Bank, the Merchant will furnish necessary proof in this regard.
Return of Product by Customer and cancellation of Loan:
In case where a Customer initiates a return of the Product to the Merchant and the Merchant accepts the return in accordance with the Product’s return policies within a week, such an action shall amount to cancellation of the Loan by the Bank to the Customer.
As more particularly described in Schedule 3 hereto, the Merchant will share the list of Customers whose return of the Product has been accepted by the Merchant with the Bank as and when required through the cancellation API.
While disbursing the Loan amount(s) as mentioned under Clause 2.2 hereto, the Bank shall have the right to deduct/ set-off the amounts pertaining to cancelled Loans amounts., the Bank shall disburse only the difference in the Loan amounts of the Customers whose Loan the Bank has boarded and the cancelled Loan amounts. The balance amount of the Loan for the Product shall therefore be paid by the Merchant to the Manufacturer, as if disbursed by the Bank. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary, the Bank shall be deemed to have disbursed the complete Loan amount(s) to the Merchant as if no set off was done by it.
For each Loan granted by the Bank,  an  email will be sent by the Merchant from [ noreply@softcell.com]  to the Bank with the name of the Customer, date of purchase of Product, Product details, Product Price, Loan amount disbursed by the Bank, Terms & Conditions accepted by the Customer by way of Online Acceptance on the Merchant Platform and such other details and in such form and manner as the Bank may require. For this purpose, the Bank shall specify an email address from time to time. The Merchant shall also copy the Customer to whom such a Loan is being granted on every such email being sent to the Bank. The Merchant shall use the corporate email address of the Customer, as registered with the Bank for these purposes.

As and when required by the Bank, the Merchant undertakes and confirms that it shall forthwith submit to the Bank and/or any court of law/ tribunal/ any other forum, as required by the Bank, a certificate certifying fulfilment of all requirements under the provisions of Section 65B of the Indian Evidence Act, 1872, including for submitting the evidence of and proving the electronic records of the Customer’s Online Acceptance of the Terms & Conditions of the Loan, on the Merchant’s Platform. Notwithstanding anything contained in this Agreement and any other document, this sub-clause shall survive the term of this Agreement. 
Further, the Merchant undertakes to do, perform, submit all such acts, writings and certificates as the Bank may deem necessary for evidentiary purposes from time to time including, but not limited to producing computer outputs and/or paper prints (certified) and/or in any other or additional form and on additional or other medium of the relevant electronic records, including submitting the same to the court/ tribunal under affidavit as may be required by the Bank, from time to time any time in future. 
The Merchant expressly confirms and undertakes to fulfil at all times all the conditions and requirements in relation to submission of a certificate as required to be provided by the Merchant under Clause 3.2 above, namely: 
that the computer output containing the information under this Agreement was produced by the computer during the period over which the computer was used regularly to store or process information for the purposes of any activities regularly carried on over that period by the person having lawful control over the use of the computer;
during the said period, information of the kind contained in the electronic record or of the kind from which the information so contained is derived was regularly fed into the computer in the ordinary course of the said activities;
throughout the material part of the said period, the computer was operating properly or, if not, then in respect of any period in which it was not operating properly or was out of operation during that part of the period, was not such as to affect the electronic record or the accuracy of its contents; and
the information contained in the electronic record reproduces or is derived from such information fed into the computer in the ordinary course of the said activities.
Where over any period, the function of storing or processing information for the purposes of any activities regularly carried on over that period as mentioned in this Clause, was regularly performed by computers, whether –
by a combination of computers operating over that period; or
by different computers operating in succession over that period; or
by different combinations of computers operating in succession over that period; or
in any other manner involving the successive operation over that period, in whatever order, of one or more computers and one or more combinations of computers, all the computers used for that purpose during that period shall be treated as constituting a single computer and references in this sub-clause to a computer shall be construed accordingly. 
Notwithstanding anything contained in this Agreement and any other document, this sub-clause shall survive the term of this Agreement. 
The Merchant hereby unconditionally and expressly confirms that in any proceeding where the Bank or any court requires the Merchant to give a statement in evidence by virtue of Clause 3.2, a certificate doing any or all of the following things, shall be submitted by it, that is to say:
identifying the electronic record containing the statement and describing the manner in which it was produced;
giving such particulars of any device involved in the production of that electronic record as may be appropriate for the purpose of showing that the electronic record was produced by a computer;
dealing with any of the matters to which the conditions mentioned in sub-clause (1) above relate, and purporting to be signed by a person occupying a responsible official position in relation to the operation of the relevant device or the management of the relevant activities (whichever is appropriate) shall be evidence of any matter stated in the certificate; and for the purposes of this sub-clause it shall be sufficient for a matter to be stated to the best of the knowledge and belief of the person stating it.
Notwithstanding anything contained in this Agreement and any other document, this sub-clause shall survive the term of this Agreement. 
The Merchant undertakes and confirms to preserve all aforesaid electronic records and system logs for such time till all evidentiary requirement of the Bank may exist, or for the minimum period for which the Bank is required to maintain and/or preserve any records under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act, 2002 including any rules thereunder and any guidelines, notifications, circulars issued in this regard by the Reserve Bank of India. Notwithstanding anything contained in this Agreement and any other document, this sub-clause shall survive the term of this Agreement. 
The Merchant confirms and agrees that it systems fully is/ are and shall at all times during the continuance of this Agreement be:
compliant with the provisions of the Information Technology Act, 2000 and the applicable rules thereunder including without limitation the Information Technology (Reasonable security practices and procedures and sensitive personal data or information) Rules, 2011; 
compliant with all applicable notifications, guidelines, circulars, issued by RBI, in relation to securing card transactions;

DISBURSAL PROCESS.
The Merchant agrees and acknowledges that it shall not have any lien, charge, encumbrance or any similar right over any payment made/ amount received by the Customer. As more particularly described in Schedule 3 hereto, the Merchant will share the list of Customers whose Loans were approved by the Bank on a particular day. This will be done on a daily basis by the Merchant. The Bank shall disburse the Loan availed by the Customers to the Merchant’s account within a period of two(2) working days from the Approval of the Loans after netting off fees/charges, if any. (“Disbursal Process”) 
Neither the Merchant nor the Customer shall have any right of lien, set-off or counterclaim or withholding or deduction including any deduction of or withholding for or on account of any Tax of any nature or any similar right having hereby been irrevocably waived.
In consideration of fulfilment and performance of the obligations under this Agreement, such Fee as may be stipulated in the Fee Letter, which shall be separately agreed upon and signed by the Parties, shall be payable by the relevant Party as mentioned in the Fee Letter. If so required by the Bank, the Merchant shall provide to the Bank Goods and Services Tax related registration numbers including Goods and Services Tax Identification Number ("GSTIN"), any proof or documents the Bank may require in this regard and all such details, information, documents, papers as the Bank may require in this regard, to enable the Bank to claim input credits as and when required by the Bank. The Bank shall be entitled to rely on any such information or details without verifying the correctness of the same. Any payment of Fee by the Bank to the Merchant, if applicable, shall be full discharge of the Bank’s obligations and the Merchant shall not have any claim against the Bank for such portion of the Fee which is so paid from time to time.The Fees shall be exclusive of all goods and services tax (including, without limitation, CGST, SGST, UTGST, IGST, J&KGST) and applicable cess/ surcharge. In case any input tax credit, refund or other benefit is denied or delayed due to any breach, delay or non-compliance by the Merchant (including, without limitation, as a result of failure to upload the details of the sale on the goods and service tax network (GSTN) portal, failure to pay goods and services tax to the relevant Governmental Authority or due to non-furnishing or furnishing of incorrect or incomplete documents by the Merchant), the Merchant shall reimburse to the Bank, the loss suffered by the Bank including, but not limited to, the tax loss, interest and penalty. The above-mentioned penalty will be subject to the levy of applicable goods and services tax and cess/ surcharge.
The Parties shall be entitled to deduct tax at source on payments made hereunder in accordance with the Applicable Law. Where the Bank is entitled to deduct tax at source on payments, the Merchant shall be responsible to report any non-receipt of certificate of taxes deducted at source within 90 (Ninety) days of deduction of such taxes at source by the Bank.
The Merchant shall extend all the required co-operation in the defense of any claim/s by any Governmental Authority against the Bank with respect to any taxes and/ or duties due and payable by, or under the authority of the Merchant.

The Parties hereby agree and acknowledge that at all points in time during the Term of this Agreement, the Bank shall upon giving a prior written notice of 10 (ten) days to the Merchant, be entitled to either by itself, or through its internal or external auditors or any external specialists appointed by it in this behalf (“Bank’s Authorised Personnel”), to audit, review, monitor and assess the use of any software, data or other materials, Customer Information, all the documents, records, (including copies of any audit carried out or review reports and findings made with regard to the Services), information, books or transactions, the security practices, control processes and other necessary information in the nature of operations, financial and business records which the Bank / Bank’s Authorised Personnel in their absolute discretion deem to be relevant to the ability of the Merchant to provide the Services, and compliance by the Merchant of the terms and conditions of the Agreement. Any such audit shall not interfere with the normal business operations of Merchant and shall be conducted at Bank’s costs. The Merchant shall forthwith upon being thus required shall permit taking copies of any Records, documents, books or other writings of the Merchant, by the Bank/ Bank’s Authorised Personnel. 
Without prejudice to the right of the Bank to require audit as provided for in Clause 6.1 above, the Merchant shall regularly provide updates to the Bank with respect to the provision of the Services, and shall meet with the officials designated by the Bank to discuss and review the performance of the Merchant at such intervals as may be agreed between the Parties.
The Merchant shall during the Term of this Agreement, preserve/maintain in good order and as per generally accepted industry practices, all documents, data and records in relation to the provision of the Services as contemplated under this Agreement which documents and records shall at all times be in accordance with the Applicable Law. In addition to the same, the Merchant shall retain requisite audit trails and logs in relation to the Services and shall make the same accessible to the Bank on request.
The Merchant shall co-operate in good faith with the Bank and its employees, representatives and the Bank’s Authorised Personnel to correct any practice, which is found to be deficient during any audit or monitoring and assessment process. Additionally, the Merchant shall make available reasonable time of a qualified professional towards responding to queries that may arise in the course of such monitoring or assessment process on mutually agreed terms.
Notwithstanding anything contained herein, it is hereby agreed between the Parties that any government regulator who is entitled to regulate and supervise the activities of the Bank, including the Reserve Bank of India and/or any persons authorised by such regulator shall be entitled to require the Merchant to furnish and submit such data, documents and records, and / or inspect / cause an inspection to be made of the Merchant and its respective operations or books and accounts by one or more of its officers or employees or other persons, or enter upon the premises of the Merchant and access, inspect, examine, audit and call for all the documents, records or transactions and other necessary information given to, stored or processed by the Merchant (including information maintained in paper and/or electronic formats) in the nature of operations and business records and which the regulator may, in its sole and absolute discretion, deem to be relevant to the provision of the Services and the other terms and conditions, as set forth in the Agreement, with or without provision of prior notice, as the regulator may deem fit and necessary.
In the event that any data, information, documents or Records, which are required by the Bank, the Bank’s Authorised Personnel and / or any such regulator is stored or maintained at any location other than the premises of the Merchant (whether in India or abroad), the Merchant shall ensure that the Bank, the Bank’s Authorised Personnel and / or the concerned regulator, as the case may be, has access to such data, information or records to the same extent as if such data, information and Records were maintained by the Merchant at its own premises.
The Bank understands that during the audit process, it may access confidential information relating to the Merchant’s systems. The Bank hereby agrees to destroy or return all confidential information received by it or any third party appointed by the Bank once the audit process is completed except for any data/information which the Bank in its opinion requires for any regulatory compliances or pursuant to or in relation to any legal, regulatory, judicial, quasi-judicial, governmental, statutory requirements, proceedings, orders, directions, etc 
The Bank shall have a right to review and monitor the security practices and control processes of the Merchant on a regular basis and require the Merchant to disclose security breaches, if any, without prejudice to Bank’s other rights and remedies in this regard. 
COMMUNICATIONS & PUBLICITY
No Party shall publicly advertise the terms and conditions of this Agreement or publish any press release relating to this Agreement without the advance written approval of the other Parties, such approval not to be unreasonably withheld or delayed. The scope of such approval may include approval of use of each approving Party’s trade names, trademarks (whether registered or not) and logos in all advertisements. The Merchant agrees that no advertisement regarding or relating to the Bank, its products, trade name(s), trade mark(s), symbol(s), logo(s) or the words ____________________________________ and any variations or misspellings, be it separately or in combination with other keywords or trade names, shall be issued or published by  the Merchant and/or without the prior written consent of the Bank, such consent not to be unreasonably withheld or delayed.

This Agreement shall come into force from the Effective Date and shall be in force and effect for the period of 3 (Three) years (“Term”), unless terminated earlier in accordance with the provisions of this Agreement. After completion of the Term, this Agreement may be renewed for a further periods of 3 (Three) year(s) by the Parties, upon such mutually agreed terms and conditions, as the Parties may agree, in writing. 
Either Party shall have the right to terminate this Agreement without assigning a reason by issuing 60 (sixty) days prior written notice to the other Party to that effect. 
Either Party shall be entitled to forthwith terminate this Agreement in the event that:
the other Party is in default of any of its material obligations hereunder and such default is not remedied within sixty (60) days from receipt of written notice thereof from the non-defaulting Party, 
the other Party is adjudicated bankrupt or becomes insolvent, makes any assignment for the benefit of creditors, proceedings are instituted by the such Party seeking relief, reorganization or rearrangement under any laws relating to insolvency, bankruptcy or similar laws of any jurisdiction, a receiver, liquidator or trustee is appointed in respect of any property or assets of the other Party or an order is made for the liquidation, dissolution or winding up of the other Party. 
Notwithstanding the foregoing, the Bank shall be entitled to forthwith terminate this Agreement in the event a regulatory order is passed, which prejudicially affects the Bank’s ability to continue with the collaboration envisaged herein;
Upon termination of this Agreement for any reasons whatsoever or expiry of this Agreement, as the case may be :
The Merchant shall forthwith hand over to the Bank the possession of all documents, material and any other property belonging to the Bank and the customers or pertaining to the Loan that may be in the possession of the Merchant;
The Merchant will cease to sell, promote, market or advertise the Loan and shall remove all signs and boards in connection with the Loan from its premises; and
Each Party shall refrain from any action that would or may indicate any relationship between it;
Each Party will immediately cease to use in any manner whatsoever the trademarks, name, and logos of the other Party.
Consequences of expiry or termination of this Agreement 
In the event of termination by either Party as per clause 9.2 mentioned hereinabove, the rights and obligations of the Parties under this Agreement shall continue in full force and effect during the notice period (i.e. a period of 180 days) till the applicable date of termination of the Agreement.
The expiry or the termination of this Agreement shall not affect:
The obligations of the Parties under Clauses 3.2, 3.3, 3.4, 3.5, 3.6 , 6.7, 8, 10 , 11 and Clause II of Schedule 6 of this Agreement. 
The accrued rights and obligations of the Parties including in relation to all Customers who have been granted Loans by the Bank till the point of any termination shall remain in full force and effect and be enforceable notwithstanding such expiry or termination.

The Merchant authorises the Bank during the subsistence of this Agreement to include the Merchant’s name in any catalogue, directly or in any other promotional material as may be prepared or produced by the Bank pertaining to provision of the Loans.
